  <li id=\"_note-20\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Use-a-Weighted-Blanket-for-Better-Sleep#_ref-20\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://sleepcouncil.org.uk/advice-support/sleep-advice/sleep-hygiene/\">https://sleepcouncil.org.uk/advice-support/sleep-advice/sleep-hygiene/</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-21\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Use-a-Weighted-Blanket-for-Better-Sleep#_ref-21\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://medlineplus.gov/healthysleep.html\">https://medlineplus.gov/healthysleep.html</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-22\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Use-a-Weighted-Blanket-for-Better-Sleep#_ref-22\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://www.mayoclinic.org/healthy-lifestyle/adult-health/in-depth/sleep/art-20048379\">https://www.mayoclinic.org/healthy-lifestyle/adult-health/in-depth/sleep/art-20048379</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-23\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Use-a-Weighted-Blanket-for-Better-Sleep#_ref-23\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://medlineplus.gov/healthysleep.html\">https://medlineplus.gov/healthysleep.html</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-24\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Use-a-Weighted-Blanket-for-Better-Sleep#_ref-24\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://sleepcouncil.org.uk/advice-support/sleep-advice/sleep-hygiene/\">https://sleepcouncil.org.uk/advice-support/sleep-advice/sleep-hygiene/</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-25\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Use-a-Weighted-Blanket-for-Better-Sleep#_ref-25\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://www.mayoclinic.org/healthy-lifestyle/adult-health/in-depth/sleep/art-20048379\">https://www.mayoclinic.org/healthy-lifestyle/adult-health/in-depth/sleep/art-20048379</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-26\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Use-a-Weighted-Blanket-for-Better-Sleep#_ref-26\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://medlineplus.gov/healthysleep.html\">https://medlineplus.gov/healthysleep.html</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-27\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Use-a-Weighted-Blanket-for-Better-Sleep#_ref-27\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://www.oxfordhealth.nhs.uk/wp-content/uploads/2014/05/Sensory-Weighted-Product-Advice.pdf\">https://www.oxfordhealth.nhs.uk/wp-content/uploads/2014/05/Sensory-Weighted-Product-Advice.pdf</a></span> </li> \n  </ol>\n </div> \n</div>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Thu, 10 Sep 2020 00:00:00 +0000","feedId":44,"bgimg":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/92/Use-a-Weighted-Blanket-for-Better-Sleep-Step-1-Version-2.jpg/aid12048013-v4-728px-Use-a-Weighted-Blanket-for-Better-Sleep-Step-1-Version-2.jpg","linkMd5":"fd677e6cb2da06aa8721ea8f8c3a5689","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn36@2020_4/2020/09/16/05-03-48-057_f5ebc69a12119dc0.webp","destWidth":728,"destHeight":546,"sourceBytes":54771,"destBytes":36502,"author":"","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/92/Use-a-Weighted-Blanket-for-Better-Sleep-Step-1-Version-2.jpg/aid12048013-v4-728px-Use-a-Weighted-Blanket-for-Better-Sleep-Step-1-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn36@2020_4/2020/09/16/05-03-48-057_f5ebc69a12119dc0.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/80/Use-a-Weighted-Blanket-for-Better-Sleep-Step-2-Version-2.jpg/aid12048013-v4-728px-Use-a-Weighted-Blanket-for-Better-Sleep-Step-2-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn100@2020_2/2020/09/16/05-04-09-036_a92d4f576d3d8781.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/6f/Use-a-Weighted-Blanket-for-Better-Sleep-Step-3-Version-2.jpg/aid12048013-v4-728px-Use-a-Weighted-Blanket-for-Better-Sleep-Step-3-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn99@2020_5/2020/09/16/05-04-11-307_1afd6f3c1dd68fb5.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/1e/Use-a-Weighted-Blanket-for-Better-Sleep-Step-4-Version-2.jpg/aid12048013-v4-728px-Use-a-Weighted-Blanket-for-Better-Sleep-Step-4-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn84@2020_3/2020/09/16/05-04-06-224_39ab51e45f38076a.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/63/Use-a-Weighted-Blanket-for-Better-Sleep-Step-5-Version-2.jpg/aid12048013-v4-728px-Use-a-Weighted-Blanket-for-Better-Sleep-Step-5-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn39@2020_1/2020/09/16/05-04-13-402_eb7e4e93e39439b9.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/24/Use-a-Weighted-Blanket-for-Better-Sleep-Step-6-Version-2.jpg/aid12048013-v4-728px-Use-a-Weighted-Blanket-for-Better-Sleep-Step-6-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn95@2020_3/2020/09/16/05-04-12-910_cceddfc6c31083b1.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/ff/Use-a-Weighted-Blanket-for-Better-Sleep-Step-7-Version-2.jpg/aid12048013-v4-728px-Use-a-Weighted-Blanket-for-Better-Sleep-Step-7-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn92@2020_5/2020/09/16/05-04-07-394_77b1e5a1b7060787.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/44/Use-a-Weighted-Blanket-for-Better-Sleep-Step-8-Version-2.jpg/aid12048013-v4-728px-Use-a-Weighted-Blanket-for-Better-Sleep-Step-8-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn67@2020_6/2020/09/16/05-04-09-541_a4e4a68a929fae3d.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/3e/Use-a-Weighted-Blanket-for-Better-Sleep-Step-9-Version-2.jpg/aid12048013-v4-728px-Use-a-Weighted-Blanket-for-Better-Sleep-Step-9-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx23/cdn47@2020_1/2020/09/16/05-04-13-381_53b34fa43562dc60.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/25/Use-a-Weighted-Blanket-for-Better-Sleep-Step-10-Version-2.jpg/aid12048013-v4-728px-Use-a-Weighted-Blanket-for-Better-Sleep-Step-10-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn44@2020_6/2020/09/16/05-04-12-427_5cf71543e225f622.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/31/Use-a-Weighted-Blanket-for-Better-Sleep-Step-11-Version-2.jpg/aid12048013-v4-728px-Use-a-Weighted-Blanket-for-Better-Sleep-Step-11-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn76@2020_3/2020/09/16/05-04-13-483_c935747e1406579e.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/7b/Use-a-Weighted-Blanket-for-Better-Sleep-Step-12-Version-2.jpg/aid12048013-v4-728px-Use-a-Weighted-Blanket-for-Better-Sleep-Step-12-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn20@2020_3/2020/09/16/05-04-10-242_172619e222beb0ee.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/2a/Use-a-Weighted-Blanket-for-Better-Sleep-Step-13-Version-2.jpg/aid12048013-v4-728px-Use-a-Weighted-Blanket-for-Better-Sleep-Step-13-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn8@2020_1/2020/09/16/05-04-08-105_fad921013ca9d5d9.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/25/Use-a-Weighted-Blanket-for-Better-Sleep-Step-14-Version-2.jpg/aid12048013-v4-728px-Use-a-Weighted-Blanket-for-Better-Sleep-Step-14-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn72@2020_1/2020/09/16/05-04-08-606_ceff68566f719e3b.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/37/Use-a-Weighted-Blanket-for-Better-Sleep-Step-15-Version-2.jpg/aid12048013-v4-728px-Use-a-Weighted-Blanket-for-Better-Sleep-Step-15-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn87@2020_4/2020/09/16/05-04-11-313_eb1a5453b11c804b.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1600232627606},{"createdTime":"2020-09-16 13:03:47","updatedTime":"2020-09-16 13:03:47","title":"How to Make a LEGO Castle","link":"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-a-LEGO-Castle","description":"<div class=\"mw-parser-output\">\n <p>There are a ton of LEGO castle-building sets, but you don’t have to have a set of specific instructions to make your own castle. With a solid foundation, the right building technique, and a good design idea, you can easily build one. </p> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Make-a-LEGO-Castle&amp;action=edit&amp;section=1\" title=\"Edit section: Steps\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Steps\">Steps</span></h2> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Make-a-LEGO-Castle&amp;action=edit&amp;section=2\" title=\"Edit section: Building Walls, Gates, and Towers\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span id=\"Building-Walls,-Gates,-and-Towers\"></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Building-Walls.2C-Gates.2C-and-Towers\">Building Walls, Gates, and Towers</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Choose a flat base plate to form the base of the wall. LEGO base plates are the flat pieces often used as flooring in a model. Use a flat base plate to give your first layer of bricks a surface to attach to so they’re sturdy.<sup id=\"_ref-1\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 1\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-a-LEGO-Castle#_note-1\">[1]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-a-LEGO-Castle-Step-1-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make a LEGO Castle Step 1 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/29/Make-a-LEGO-Castle-Step-1-Version-2.jpg/aid774514-v4-728px-Make-a-LEGO-Castle-Step-1-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>You can choose multiple flat base plates to build your foundation or use a large single one.</li> \n    <li>Choose a brown base plate to mimic dirt or a green one to look like grass.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Place rectangular bricks on the base plates to start your wall. Form the first layer of your castle wall by attaching rectangular LEGO bricks to your base plates. Place them end to end so they’re touching and form a single layer.<sup id=\"_ref-2\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 2\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-a-LEGO-Castle#_note-2\">[2]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-a-LEGO-Castle-Step-2-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make a LEGO Castle Step 2 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/8f/Make-a-LEGO-Castle-Step-2-Version-2.jpg/aid774514-v4-728px-Make-a-LEGO-Castle-Step-2-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If you want to give your castle a classic look, use gray bricks.</li> \n    <li>Try to use bricks of the same size so your wall looks more uniform.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Use an interlocking technique to stack additional bricks. An interlocking technique means you take 2 bricks touching end to end, and lay 1 brick across them to keep them connected. As you continue stacking your bricks and building your wall, use an interlocking technique to make your wall sturdier.<sup id=\"_ref-3\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 3\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-a-LEGO-Castle#_note-3\">[3]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-a-LEGO-Castle-Step-3-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make a LEGO Castle Step 3 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e4/Make-a-LEGO-Castle-Step-3-Version-2.jpg/aid774514-v4-728px-Make-a-LEGO-Castle-Step-3-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>An interlocking design is a classic brick wall technique, so using it for your castle will make it look more like a real wall.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Leave larger gaps at the bottom of the wall to create gates. As you’re stacking your bricks and building your castle wall, choose where you want to place a gate. Leave a larger gap between 2 sides of your wall to leave a gate opening. If you have a LEGO gate piece or drawbridge, add it to the opening and build around it.<sup id=\"_ref-4\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 4\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-a-LEGO-Castle#_note-4\">[4]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-a-LEGO-Castle-Step-4-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make a LEGO Castle Step 4 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/5f/Make-a-LEGO-Castle-Step-4-Version-2.jpg/aid774514-v4-728px-Make-a-LEGO-Castle-Step-4-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If you’re making a larger castle, you can make multiple gate openings.</li> \n    <li>The gate opening can be any size you like, but a proper castle must have a gate!</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Stagger the bricks to create openings for windows. If you want to add some windows to your castle walls, leave an extra space between 2 bricks so there’s a small opening. Then, continue stacking your castle in an interlocking fashion.<sup id=\"_ref-5\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 5\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-a-LEGO-Castle#_note-5\">[5]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-a-LEGO-Castle-Step-5-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make a LEGO Castle Step 5 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/af/Make-a-LEGO-Castle-Step-5-Version-2.jpg/aid774514-v4-728px-Make-a-LEGO-Castle-Step-5-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>You can adjust the size of your windows by leaving a smaller or a larger gap between bricks.</li> \n    <li>If you have square bricks, you can stagger them to create a series of small windows.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Add towers above the gates by stacking corner bricks. If you want to add some towers on top of your gates, use 3-studded corner bricks to add a textured design effect. Stack them on top of your gate and place rectangular bricks across them to create a roof.<sup id=\"_ref-6\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 6\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-a-LEGO-Castle#_note-6\">[6]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-a-LEGO-Castle-Step-6-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make a LEGO Castle Step 6 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/62/Make-a-LEGO-Castle-Step-6-Version-2.jpg/aid774514-v4-728px-Make-a-LEGO-Castle-Step-6-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>You can also add smaller bricks on top to give the tower a spire, or a point.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Space out square pieces on top for a classic castle design. Once you’ve finished building a section of your castle wall, add some square pieces on top to give it that classic medieval design effect. Space out the square bricks evenly so it looks consistent.<sup id=\"_ref-7\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 7\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-a-LEGO-Castle#_note-7\">[7]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-a-LEGO-Castle-Step-7-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make a LEGO Castle Step 7 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e6/Make-a-LEGO-Castle-Step-7-Version-2.jpg/aid774514-v4-728px-Make-a-LEGO-Castle-Step-7-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Create corner turrets by stacking bricks in a square design. A turret is a tower that’s usually placed at the corners of a castle. Stack rectangular bricks in a square pattern to build turrets and then place them at the corners of your walls.<sup id=\"_ref-8\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 8\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-a-LEGO-Castle#_note-8\">[8]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-a-LEGO-Castle-Step-8.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make a LEGO Castle Step 8.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/7c/Make-a-LEGO-Castle-Step-8.jpg/aid774514-v4-728px-Make-a-LEGO-Castle-Step-8.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Make the turrets taller than your walls.</li> \n    <li>If you’re making multiple turrets, build them the same size and height so your castle looks even.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Create bridges with base plates between towers or walls. Use brown base plates so the bridges look wooden. Attach them to the tops of walls or towers to connect 2 of them together and form a bridge that your LEGO people can cross.<sup id=\"_ref-9\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 9\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-a-LEGO-Castle#_note-9\">[9]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-a-LEGO-Castle-Step-9.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make a LEGO Castle Step 9.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d7/Make-a-LEGO-Castle-Step-9.jpg/aid774514-v4-728px-Make-a-LEGO-Castle-Step-9.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>You could also use gray base plates to look like stone bridges.</li> \n    <li>Add thin rectangular bricks to the sides of the bridges to make railings.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Make-a-LEGO-Castle&amp;action=edit&amp;section=3\" title=\"Edit section: Choosing Castle Designs\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Choosing-Castle-Designs\">Choosing Castle Designs</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Look for instructions on the LEGO website if you want a specific design. If you want to build a specific castle design, you can use the official instructions as a guide. Search on the LEGO website or in a search engine for the castle design you’re looking for and print out or read the directions on your screen.<sup id=\"_ref-10\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 10\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-a-LEGO-Castle#_note-10\">[10]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-a-LEGO-Castle-Step-10.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make a LEGO Castle Step 10.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/5d/Make-a-LEGO-Castle-Step-10.jpg/aid774514-v4-728px-Make-a-LEGO-Castle-Step-10.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>To visit the LEGO website, go to: <a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://www.lego.com/\">https://www.lego.com/</a>.</li> \n    <li>You may need to find or buy specialized pieces in order to build some of the designs.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Use the Kingdom’s Modular Castle Creator for a variety of designs. You can use LEGO castle “modules” which are sets that can be configured in multiple ways to give you a lot of different design options. The set includes instructions and all of the pieces you’ll need to build interchangeable modules, which you can use to create castle designs of your own.<sup id=\"_ref-11\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 11\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-a-LEGO-Castle#_note-11\">[11]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-a-LEGO-Castle-Step-11.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make a LEGO Castle Step 11.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/48/Make-a-LEGO-Castle-Step-11.jpg/aid774514-v4-728px-Make-a-LEGO-Castle-Step-11.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>You can purchase the Kingdom’s Modular Castle Creator online.</li> \n    <li>Most of the designs in the modular require specialized pieces that are included in the set.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Find specialty castle sets if you want to build a specific design. LEGO makes sets that include instructions and all of the pieces that you’ll need to build a specific castle, such as Cinderella’s castle or Queen Elsa’s castle from Frozen. Search online for specific castle designs offered by LEGO and choose the one you want to build.<sup id=\"_ref-12\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 12\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-a-LEGO-Castle#_note-12\">[12]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-a-LEGO-Castle-Step-12.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make a LEGO Castle Step 12.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/62/Make-a-LEGO-Castle-Step-12.jpg/aid774514-v4-728px-Make-a-LEGO-Castle-Step-12.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Check out the LEGO website for different castle sets you can build.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Combine multiple castle sets to form a large castle build. Choose LEGO castle design sets that you like and build them individually to combine them into a large castle. You could also use modules or pieces from the various sets to build a castle of your own design, using elements from each of the sets that you like.<sup id=\"_ref-13\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 13\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-a-LEGO-Castle#_note-13\">[13]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-a-LEGO-Castle-Step-13.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make a LEGO Castle Step 13.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e5/Make-a-LEGO-Castle-Step-13.jpg/aid774514-v4-728px-Make-a-LEGO-Castle-Step-13.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>For instance, you could take modules or pieces from a forest castle design and a medieval outpost design and use different features to make your own unique design.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Search online for inspiration for your castle design. There are a lot of LEGO builders out there who love to construct super elaborate and detailed LEGO castles. Look up LEGO castles online and search through the designs to find elements that you like and can replicate in your own castle.<sup id=\"_ref-14\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 14\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-a-LEGO-Castle#_note-14\">[14]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-a-LEGO-Castle-Step-14.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make a LEGO Castle Step 14.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/84/Make-a-LEGO-Castle-Step-14.jpg/aid774514-v4-728px-Make-a-LEGO-Castle-Step-14.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>For some LEGO castle inspiration, visit: <a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://www.brothers-brick.com/tag/castle/\">https://www.brothers-brick.com/tag/castle/</a>.</li> \n    <li>Looking at other great castle designs can help inspire your own!</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Make-a-LEGO-Castle&amp;action=edit&amp;section=4\" title=\"Edit section: Adding Details, Decorations, and Scenery\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span id=\"Adding-Details,-Decorations,-and-Scenery\"></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Adding-Details.2C-Decorations.2C-and-Scenery\">Adding Details, Decorations, and Scenery</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Attach a castle door to the outside of the wall. Use a specialized rectangular brick that has studs on the side to allow other lego pieces to be attached to them and add it to your wall design. Take a LEGO castle door piece and stick it onto the studs to add a castle door to the exterior of your wall.<sup id=\"_ref-15\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 15\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-a-LEGO-Castle#_note-15\">[15]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-a-LEGO-Castle-Step-15.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make a LEGO Castle Step 15.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/60/Make-a-LEGO-Castle-Step-15.jpg/aid774514-v4-728px-Make-a-LEGO-Castle-Step-15.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>LEGO castle doors are specialized pieces that may only come in specific building kits.</li> \n    <li>The castle door can’t be opened like a gate, but it’s a great decoration for your castle walls!</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Clip balcony modules onto walls or towers. Modules are specialized pieces that form a specific design. Choose a balcony module and attach it to a tower or wall to add balconies to your castle.<sup id=\"_ref-16\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 16\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-a-LEGO-Castle#_note-16\">[16]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-a-LEGO-Castle-Step-16.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make a LEGO Castle Step 16.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/67/Make-a-LEGO-Castle-Step-16.jpg/aid774514-v4-728px-Make-a-LEGO-Castle-Step-16.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Balcony modules require specialized pieces and may need to be purchased separately</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Place LEGO animals and people around the castle. Add some pigs, chickens, soldiers, farmers, and other figures into your castle to bring it to life. Place the soldiers along the walls and the animals around the area to create a realistic scene.<sup id=\"_ref-17\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 17\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-a-LEGO-Castle#_note-17\">[17]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-a-LEGO-Castle-Step-17.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make a LEGO Castle Step 17.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b0/Make-a-LEGO-Castle-Step-17.jpg/aid774514-v4-728px-Make-a-LEGO-Castle-Step-17.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Use your imagination! For instance, maybe there’s a mighty dragon landing on the castle walls or a LEGO person chasing after a chicken inside of the castle.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Use flat blue base plates to make a moat around the castle. A moat is a ditch filled with water surrounding a castle to help defend against attackers. Take some blue flat base plates and place them on the exterior of your castle, next to the walls. Stack them end to end around your castle to form a flowing moat.<sup id=\"_ref-18\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 18\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-a-LEGO-Castle#_note-18\">[18]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-a-LEGO-Castle-Step-18.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make a LEGO Castle Step 18.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/5b/Make-a-LEGO-Castle-Step-18.jpg/aid774514-v4-728px-Make-a-LEGO-Castle-Step-18.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Lay a brown base plate over the water in front of your castle gates to create a wooden drawbridge.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Add some plants and trees around the castle. Attach bushes around the outside of your castle walls to add some greenery. Place trees around the inside and outside of your castle to make it look more realistic and lively.<sup id=\"_ref-19\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 19\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-a-LEGO-Castle#_note-19\">[19]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-a-LEGO-Castle-Step-19.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make a LEGO Castle Step 19.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a1/Make-a-LEGO-Castle-Step-19.jpg/aid774514-v4-728px-Make-a-LEGO-Castle-Step-19.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Put some LEGO flags up around the walls and towers. If you have some LEGO banners, stick them directly onto studs on the top of your castle walls. If you have flags and flag poles, attach the flag poles to studs and connect the flags to them to make it look like they’re blowing in the wind.<sup id=\"_ref-20\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 20\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-a-LEGO-Castle#_note-20\">[20]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-a-LEGO-Castle-Step-20.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make a LEGO Castle Step 20.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/4d/Make-a-LEGO-Castle-Step-20.jpg/aid774514-v4-728px-Make-a-LEGO-Castle-Step-20.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li>\n </ol> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Make-a-LEGO-Castle&amp;action=edit&amp;section=5\" title=\"Edit section: Tips\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Tips\">Tips</span></h2> \n <ul>\n  <li>Spend some time sorting out your pieces before you start building so it’s easier to find what you need.</li> \n  <li>It’s your castle design, so have fun with it!</li>\n </ul> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Make-a-LEGO-Castle&amp;action=edit&amp;section=6\" title=\"Edit section: References\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span \n</div>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Wed, 09 Sep 2020 00:00:00 +0000","feedId":44,"bgimg":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/29/Make-a-LEGO-Castle-Step-1-Version-2.jpg/aid774514-v4-728px-Make-a-LEGO-Castle-Step-1-Version-2.jpg","linkMd5":"ef24c89d727e20ee07a1790cb5ff5a83","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn19@2020_2/2020/09/16/05-03-49-967_9aca2ec523c87783.webp","destWidth":728,"destHeight":546,"sourceBytes":49804,"destBytes":27858,"author":"","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/29/Make-a-LEGO-Castle-Step-1-Version-2.jpg/aid774514-v4-728px-Make-a-LEGO-Castle-Step-1-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn19@2020_2/2020/09/16/05-03-49-967_9aca2ec523c87783.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/8f/Make-a-LEGO-Castle-Step-2-Version-2.jpg/aid774514-v4-728px-Make-a-LEGO-Castle-Step-2-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn28@2020_5/2020/09/16/05-04-10-864_6fd037d0b35f7306.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e4/Make-a-LEGO-Castle-Step-3-Version-2.jpg/aid774514-v4-728px-Make-a-LEGO-Castle-Step-3-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn32@2020_4/2020/09/16/05-04-08-282_79f04ee91396e5e6.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/5f/Make-a-LEGO-Castle-Step-4-Version-2.jpg/aid774514-v4-728px-Make-a-LEGO-Castle-Step-4-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn11@2020_6/2020/09/16/05-04-06-350_94a59e14f81d787f.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/af/Make-a-LEGO-Castle-Step-5-Version-2.jpg/aid774514-v4-728px-Make-a-LEGO-Castle-Step-5-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn48@2020_6/2020/09/16/05-04-08-532_e75cfbdfe3641efc.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/62/Make-a-LEGO-Castle-Step-6-Version-2.jpg/aid774514-v4-728px-Make-a-LEGO-Castle-Step-6-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx23/cdn23@2020_4/2020/09/16/05-04-11-857_afc7337b4f793702.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e6/Make-a-LEGO-Castle-Step-7-Version-2.jpg/aid774514-v4-728px-Make-a-LEGO-Castle-Step-7-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn55@2020_3/2020/09/16/05-04-10-005_78af3eb77c068700.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/7c/Make-a-LEGO-Castle-Step-8.jpg/aid774514-v4-728px-Make-a-LEGO-Castle-Step-8.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn54@2020_2/2020/09/16/05-04-07-404_713545d624925f26.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d7/Make-a-LEGO-Castle-Step-9.jpg/aid774514-v4-728px-Make-a-LEGO-Castle-Step-9.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn16@2020_2/2020/09/16/05-04-08-799_ca85f2adb03f3662.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/5d/Make-a-LEGO-Castle-Step-10.jpg/aid774514-v4-728px-Make-a-LEGO-Castle-Step-10.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn51@2020_4/2020/09/16/05-04-09-207_305ea5303d884481.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/48/Make-a-LEGO-Castle-Step-11.jpg/aid774514-v4-728px-Make-a-LEGO-Castle-Step-11.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn40@2020_6/2020/09/16/05-04-11-721_bd40a77750025cf9.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/62/Make-a-LEGO-Castle-Step-12.jpg/aid774514-v4-728px-Make-a-LEGO-Castle-Step-12.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn20@2020_3/2020/09/16/05-04-07-373_e896e75950111d0a.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e5/Make-a-LEGO-Castle-Step-13.jpg/aid774514-v4-728px-Make-a-LEGO-Castle-Step-13.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn51@2020_1/2020/09/16/05-04-13-322_6d26c67971987cda.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/84/Make-a-LEGO-Castle-Step-14.jpg/aid774514-v4-728px-Make-a-LEGO-Castle-Step-14.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn56@2020_6/2020/09/16/05-04-11-894_f54effe7b5ff4285.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/60/Make-a-LEGO-Castle-Step-15.jpg/aid774514-v4-728px-Make-a-LEGO-Castle-Step-15.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn3@2020_2/2020/09/16/05-04-09-636_0046e84031c1b803.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/67/Make-a-LEGO-Castle-Step-16.jpg/aid774514-v4-728px-Make-a-LEGO-Castle-Step-16.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn41@2020_5/2020/09/16/05-04-06-199_6e4e83c6f895b079.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b0/Make-a-LEGO-Castle-Step-17.jpg/aid774514-v4-728px-Make-a-LEGO-Castle-Step-17.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn79@2020_6/2020/09/16/05-04-09-542_cadef8431a494f3e.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/5b/Make-a-LEGO-Castle-Step-18.jpg/aid774514-v4-728px-Make-a-LEGO-Castle-Step-18.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn27@2020_2/2020/09/16/05-04-08-354_a9f22e2bda23697b.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a1/Make-a-LEGO-Castle-Step-19.jpg/aid774514-v4-728px-Make-a-LEGO-Castle-Step-19.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn39@2020_5/2020/09/16/05-04-12-544_e2655762e1e5471d.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/4d/Make-a-LEGO-Castle-Step-20.jpg/aid774514-v4-728px-Make-a-LEGO-Castle-Step-20.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn96@2020_4/2020/09/16/05-04-07-671_6d48bec019a85ff6.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1600232627591},{"createdTime":"2020-09-16 13:03:47","updatedTime":"2020-09-16 13:03:47","title":"How to Do Weighted Push Ups Alone","link":"https://www.wikihow.com/Do-Weighted-Push-Ups-Alone","description":"<div class=\"mw-parser-output\">\n <p>Weighted push ups add weight to your back and shoulders, making this particular exercise even more challenging and beneficial if you’re looking to gain muscle. The most important thing when doing weighted <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Build-Muscle-Doing-Push-Ups\" title=\"Build Muscle Doing Push Ups\">push ups</a> by yourself is safety. While you can’t stack multiple weights on your back without a spotter, that doesn’t mean you can’t still get in a good workout! </p> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Do-Weighted-Push-Ups-Alone&amp;action=edit&amp;section=1\" title=\"Edit section: Steps\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Steps\">Steps</span></h2> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Do-Weighted-Push-Ups-Alone&amp;action=edit&amp;section=2\" title=\"Edit section: Choosing a Weighted Option\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Choosing-a-Weighted-Option\">Choosing a Weighted Option</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Strap on a weighted vest to increase the intensity level of your workouts. A weighted vest is an excellent investment that can be used in lots of different exercises, but it especially comes in handy with solo weighted push ups. If you’re new to weighted push ups, get a vest that weighs somewhere between&nbsp;; if you’re more experienced and know what weight you can handle, you can buy a vest up to .<sup id=\"_ref-1\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 1\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Do-Weighted-Push-Ups-Alone#_note-1\">[1]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Do-Weighted-Push-Ups-Alone-Step-01-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Do Weighted Push Ups Alone Step 01 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/5e/Do-Weighted-Push-Ups-Alone-Step-01-Version-2.jpg/aid12081671-v4-728px-Do-Weighted-Push-Ups-Alone-Step-01-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Some vests come with additional weights you can add on as you get stronger. Consider investing in one of these if you plan on increasing the weight over time.</li> \n    <li>Weighted vests focus the additional load on your shoulders and upper body, which means your lower back should be safe while you work out.</li> \n    <li>If you don’t have good form and haven’t mastered an unweighted push up, wait to use a weighted vest. It can injure your body if you aren’t already a pro at regular push ups.</li> \n    <li>In addition to benefiting your push-up practice, a weighted vest is great for cardio health. Try wearing it and taking a hike to get in an aggressive sweat-session.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Use bands to challenge yourself and provide resistance during push ups. Long, thin resistance bands are easy to get in place by yourself, and there’s no risk of hurting your back or shoulders from a slipping weight. Wrap the band between your first finger and thumb on each hand, so it’s hooked across your palms. Position the band across your shoulders so that it’s even with your elbows, and then assume your push-up position.<sup id=\"_ref-2\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 2\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Do-Weighted-Push-Ups-Alone#_note-2\">[2]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Do-Weighted-Push-Ups-Alone-Step-02-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Do Weighted Push Ups Alone Step 02 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/1d/Do-Weighted-Push-Ups-Alone-Step-02-Version-2.jpg/aid12081671-v4-728px-Do-Weighted-Push-Ups-Alone-Step-02-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Make sure the band is flexible enough that you can extend your arms while the band is across your shoulders.</li> \n    <li>As you get stronger, switch to tauter bands for even more resistance.</li> \n    <li>If you’re traveling, bands are a great option to bring along with you. They’re lightweight, but they can do a lot to help you get in a great workout.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Wear a backpack filled with water jugs for a makeshift weighted push up. Use a backpack with chest and shoulder straps so you can safely secure it around your body. Fill the backpack with as much weight as you want, then add towels to the empty space to keep the jugs from slipping around. Make sure to pack the backpack tightly with towels so the jugs stay balanced.<sup id=\"_ref-3\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 3\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Do-Weighted-Push-Ups-Alone#_note-3\">[3]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Do-Weighted-Push-Ups-Alone-Step-03.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Do Weighted Push Ups Alone Step 03.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/92/Do-Weighted-Push-Ups-Alone-Step-03.jpg/aid12081671-v4-728px-Do-Weighted-Push-Ups-Alone-Step-03.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>This method is fantastic if you’re at home without any special workout equipment.</li> \n    <li>Water jugs or bottles make it easy to adjust how much weight you’re lifting. Use a jug for the main source of weight and add additional pounds with water bottles if you want to.</li> \n    <li>Make sure to position the backpack up on your shoulders so that it doesn’t strain your lower back.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Slide a weight around your back, balance it, and assume a push-up stance. For this method, use a round, flat barbell weight rather than dumbbells or hand weights. If you can’t lift the weight by hand, choose another method. Kneel on the ground and carefully grasp the weight behind your back. Balance it across your shoulders as you bend over, release one hand down to the floor, and then carefully get into position. Do your push ups while the weight balanced across your shoulders.<sup id=\"_ref-4\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 4\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Do-Weighted-Push-Ups-Alone#_note-4\">[4]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Do-Weighted-Push-Ups-Alone-Step-04.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Do Weighted Push Ups Alone Step 04.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/0e/Do-Weighted-Push-Ups-Alone-Step-04.jpg/aid12081671-v4-728px-Do-Weighted-Push-Ups-Alone-Step-04.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>When you’re done with the push ups, put your knees back on the ground, reach up with one hand to balance the weight, then carefully raise your chest and grasp the other side of the weight before moving it to the ground.</li> \n    <li>This option is riskier because you’re working with a heavy weight by yourself.</li> \n    <li>You can generally only do this option on your own when using a single weight. It would be tough and potentially dangerous to load 2 or more weights on your back by yourself.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Do-Weighted-Push-Ups-Alone&amp;action=edit&amp;section=3\" title=\"Edit section: Performing a Safe Weighted Push Up\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Performing-a-Safe-Weighted-Push-Up\">Performing a Safe Weighted Push Up</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Lower yourself onto your knees on an exercise mat. Depending on which method you’re using to do a weighted <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Do-a-Push-Up\" title=\"Do a Push Up\">push up</a>, get your weighted vest, band, backpack, or barbell weight in position. Make sure you have whatever you need to start exercising.<sup id=\"_ref-5\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 5\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Do-Weighted-Push-Ups-Alone#_note-5\">[5]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Do-Weighted-Push-Ups-Alone-Step-05.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Do Weighted Push Ups Alone Step 05.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/7a/Do-Weighted-Push-Ups-Alone-Step-05.jpg/aid12081671-v4-728px-Do-Weighted-Push-Ups-Alone-Step-05.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>The exercise mat provides a little bit of cushioning for your knees and can be used in many other exercises.</li> \n    <li>If you don’t have an exercise mat, use knee pads or even a pillow.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Get down on the ground and place your hands shoulder-width apart. Position your hands so they’re palm-down next to your shoulders. Make sure your weighted option is positioned across your shoulders and isn’t putting a strain on your lower back.<sup id=\"_ref-6\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 6\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Do-Weighted-Push-Ups-Alone#_note-6\">[6]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Do-Weighted-Push-Ups-Alone-Step-06.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Do Weighted Push Ups Alone Step 06.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/59/Do-Weighted-Push-Ups-Alone-Step-06.jpg/aid12081671-v4-728px-Do-Weighted-Push-Ups-Alone-Step-06.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If you decide the weight is too much, reduce it before you begin your push ups.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Set your feet about shoulder-width apart and put your toes on the ground. Position your feet so the backs of your heels point toward the ceiling. At the most, set your feet apart. The closer together you put your feet, the more challenging your push up will be.<sup id=\"_ref-7\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 7\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Do-Weighted-Push-Ups-Alone#_note-7\">[7]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Do-Weighted-Push-Ups-Alone-Step-07-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Do Weighted Push Ups Alone Step 07 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/6a/Do-Weighted-Push-Ups-Alone-Step-07-Version-2.jpg/aid12081671-v4-728px-Do-Weighted-Push-Ups-Alone-Step-07-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>A great exercise to help get your body ready for push ups is the <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Perform-the-Plank-Exercise\" title=\"Perform the Plank Exercise\">plank</a>.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Push your body up off the ground while keeping your back straight. From your shoulders to your heels, keep your body in a straight line. Extend your arms as if you’re pushing the ground away from your body.<sup id=\"_ref-8\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 8\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Do-Weighted-Push-Ups-Alone#_note-8\">[8]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Do-Weighted-Push-Ups-Alone-Step-08.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Do Weighted Push Ups Alone Step 08.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/75/Do-Weighted-Push-Ups-Alone-Step-08.jpg/aid12081671-v4-728px-Do-Weighted-Push-Ups-Alone-Step-08.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Focus on using your core muscles and thighs to help stabilize your body. You have extra weight on your shoulders, so you’ll need to activate those muscles even more to keep your body straight.</li> \n    <li>Don't let your hips sink down or come up too high. Your body should form a straight line from your shoulders to your toes.<sup id=\"_ref-9\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 9\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Do-Weighted-Push-Ups-Alone#_note-9\">[9]</a></sup></li> \n    <li>If you experience lower back pain, elbow or wrist pain, or heavily shaking arms, you may be using too much weight. You should be able to do 8-10 reps without experiencing pain, though you should definitely feel a burn in your muscles.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Lower your body back to the ground while maintaining a straight line. Either keep your elbows tucked next to your side to work your triceps, or bend them out away from your body to work your pectoral muscles. If you want, bring your body back to the ground before doing another push up. Or, you could lower yourself so that your face is about level with your elbows before resuming your set.<sup id=\"_ref-10\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 10\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Do-Weighted-Push-Ups-Alone#_note-10\">[10]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Do-Weighted-Push-Ups-Alone-Step-09.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Do Weighted Push Ups Alone Step 09.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/84/Do-Weighted-Push-Ups-Alone-Step-09.jpg/aid12081671-v4-728px-Do-Weighted-Push-Ups-Alone-Step-09.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Try touching something to the floor, like your nose, chest, or forehead.<sup id=\"_ref-11\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 11\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Do-Weighted-Push-Ups-Alone#_note-11\">[11]</a></sup></li> \n    <li>If you feel like your form is about to break, go ahead and gently lower yourself to the ground and rest for a few beats. It’s better to go slow and be careful than to risk injuring yourself.</li> \n    <li>If you can, try to pause for 2-3 seconds before pushing yourself back up. This extended hold works your core and can add a lot to your muscle gain.</li> \n    <li>If you're having trouble raising back up, find something higher to put your hands on, like a coffee table or a bench.<sup id=\"_ref-12\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 12\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Do-Weighted-Push-Ups-Alone#_note-12\">[12]</a></sup></li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Do-Weighted-Push-Ups-Alone&amp;action=edit&amp;section=4\" title=\"Edit section: Tips\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Tips\">Tips</span></h2> \n <ul>\n  <li>If pushups hurt your wrists, try pushup bars or even a pair of dumbbells to release the pressure on your joints.<sup id=\"_ref-13\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 13\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Do-Weighted-Push-Ups-Alone#_note-13\">[13]</a></sup></li> \n  <li>Always focus on your form rather than speed when doing weighted push ups. <sup id=\"_ref-14\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 14\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Do-Weighted-Push-Ups-Alone#_note-14\">[14]</a></sup></li>\n </ul> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Do-Weighted-Push-Ups-Alone&amp;action=edit&amp;section=5\" title=\"Edit section: Warnings\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Warnings\">Warnings</span></h2> \n <ul>\n  <li>If you’re new to pushups, don’t jump straight into weighted ones! You could injure yourself and have to take a lot of time off before jumping back into your training.</li> \n  <li>Avoid doing weighted push ups every single day. Your muscles need some time to rest and recover between workouts, about 48 hours, if possible.<sup id=\"_ref-15\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 15\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Do-Weighted-Push-Ups-Alone#_note-15\">[15]</a></sup></li>\n </ul> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Do-Weighted-Push-Ups-Alone&amp;action=edit&amp;section=6\" title=\"Edit section: References\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"References\">References</span></h2>\n <div class=\"mw-references-wrap mw-references-columns\">\n  <ol class=\"references\"> \n   <li id=\"_note-1\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Do-Weighted-Push-Ups-Alone#_ref-1\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://www.outsideonline.com/2390287/types-of-pushups\">https://www.outsideonline.com/2390287/types-of-pushups</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-2\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Do-Weighted-Push-Ups-Alone#_ref-2\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://youtu.be/cOFwFzzLFWw?t=17\">https://youtu.be/cOFwFzzLFWw?t=17</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-3\"><a target=\"_blank\" noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://www.outsideonline.com/2390287/types-of-pushups\">https://www.outsideonline.com/2390287/types-of-pushups</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-8\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Do-Weighted-Push-Ups-Alone#_ref-8\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-9\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Do-Weighted-Push-Ups-Alone#_ref-9\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\">[v161179_b01]. 31 October 2019.</span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-10\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Do-Weighted-Push-Ups-Alone#_ref-10\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer <li id=\"_note-14\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Do-Weighted-Push-Ups-Alone#_ref-14\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer
