</li> \n  </ol>\n </div> \n</div>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 11 Sep 2020 00:00:00 +0000","feedId":44,"bgimg":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/5e/Do-Weighted-Push-Ups-Alone-Step-01-Version-2.jpg/aid12081671-v4-728px-Do-Weighted-Push-Ups-Alone-Step-01-Version-2.jpg","linkMd5":"f9412cac9cfe22ccf7f624d91a16724f","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn28@2020_6/2020/09/16/05-03-48-043_59fe02ed98c175b1.webp","destWidth":728,"destHeight":546,"sourceBytes":42085,"destBytes":25552,"author":"","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/5e/Do-Weighted-Push-Ups-Alone-Step-01-Version-2.jpg/aid12081671-v4-728px-Do-Weighted-Push-Ups-Alone-Step-01-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn28@2020_6/2020/09/16/05-03-48-043_59fe02ed98c175b1.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/1d/Do-Weighted-Push-Ups-Alone-Step-02-Version-2.jpg/aid12081671-v4-728px-Do-Weighted-Push-Ups-Alone-Step-02-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn13@2020_5/2020/09/16/05-04-06-209_89e4b0c71bd46038.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/92/Do-Weighted-Push-Ups-Alone-Step-03.jpg/aid12081671-v4-728px-Do-Weighted-Push-Ups-Alone-Step-03.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn27@2020_5/2020/09/16/05-04-11-655_f077e805fd2f99d9.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/0e/Do-Weighted-Push-Ups-Alone-Step-04.jpg/aid12081671-v4-728px-Do-Weighted-Push-Ups-Alone-Step-04.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn36@2020_1/2020/09/16/05-04-09-969_8e28299f285d823a.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/7a/Do-Weighted-Push-Ups-Alone-Step-05.jpg/aid12081671-v4-728px-Do-Weighted-Push-Ups-Alone-Step-05.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn20@2020_5/2020/09/16/05-04-10-671_7c48fcf7019aaeca.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/59/Do-Weighted-Push-Ups-Alone-Step-06.jpg/aid12081671-v4-728px-Do-Weighted-Push-Ups-Alone-Step-06.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn95@2020_4/2020/09/16/05-04-08-702_f57896e358877a2e.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/6a/Do-Weighted-Push-Ups-Alone-Step-07-Version-2.jpg/aid12081671-v4-728px-Do-Weighted-Push-Ups-Alone-Step-07-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn44@2020_5/2020/09/16/05-04-08-456_bfe9407b20604605.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/75/Do-Weighted-Push-Ups-Alone-Step-08.jpg/aid12081671-v4-728px-Do-Weighted-Push-Ups-Alone-Step-08.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn2@2020_6/2020/09/16/05-04-06-171_fe1f46bda24d90fb.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/84/Do-Weighted-Push-Ups-Alone-Step-09.jpg/aid12081671-v4-728px-Do-Weighted-Push-Ups-Alone-Step-09.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn26@2020_4/2020/09/16/05-04-10-926_2fa0fabcb90d7e96.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1600232627609},{"createdTime":"2020-09-16 13:03:47","updatedTime":"2020-09-16 13:03:47","title":"How to Read Scientific Articles Quickly","link":"https://www.wikihow.com/Read-Scientific-Articles-Quickly","description":"<div class=\"mw-parser-output\">\n <p>Scientific articles, densely packed with jargon, can be daunting — especially when you have to read several at a clip. While it's usually worth taking your time to read the article thoroughly, in some circumstances you just don't have that kind of time. Fortunately, you don't need to read every word of a scientific article to understand the main points. Focusing on the results, particularly the included tables and charts, enables you to digest the information quickly without having to read through a lot of complex text. </p> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Read-Scientific-Articles-Quickly&amp;action=edit&amp;section=1\" title=\"Edit section: Steps\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Steps\">Steps</span></h2> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Read-Scientific-Articles-Quickly&amp;action=edit&amp;section=2\" title=\"Edit section: Understanding Article Structure\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Understanding-Article-Structure\">Understanding Article Structure</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Skim the section headings of the article. The section headings of the article tell you how the article is organized so you can figure out how to read it and determine if it suits your purpose. Most scientific articles are organized with the following sections:<sup id=\"_ref-1\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 1\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Read-Scientific-Articles-Quickly#_note-1\">[1]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Read-Scientific-Articles-Quickly-Step-1-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Read Scientific Articles Quickly Step 1 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/72/Read-Scientific-Articles-Quickly-Step-1-Version-3.jpg/aid11950526-v4-728px-Read-Scientific-Articles-Quickly-Step-1-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Abstract</li> \n    <li>Introduction</li> \n    <li>Methods</li> \n    <li>Results</li> \n    <li>Discussion</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Glance at the tables and charts. Looking at the tables and charts before you read any other part of the article can help you determine if the article will be useful for you. If the article was assigned, the tables and charts will give you a quick understanding of the article before you start reading so what you read will make more sense.<sup id=\"_ref-2\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 2\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Read-Scientific-Articles-Quickly#_note-2\">[2]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Read-Scientific-Articles-Quickly-Step-2-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Read Scientific Articles Quickly Step 2 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/19/Read-Scientific-Articles-Quickly-Step-2-Version-2.jpg/aid11950526-v4-728px-Read-Scientific-Articles-Quickly-Step-2-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>The title of each table and chart gives you a handy summary of what the study evaluated or tested. You'll likely see similar language in the abstract of the article.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Read the abstract to get an overview of the article. The abstract gives you a basic overview of the article in 250-500 words, so you should be able to read it relatively quickly. As you read the abstract, think back to your reason for reading the article. If it's clear from the abstract that the article doesn't support your reason for reading it, you're done. There's no need to read any further if the article won't help you.<sup id=\"_ref-3\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 3\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Read-Scientific-Articles-Quickly#_note-3\">[3]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Read-Scientific-Articles-Quickly-Step-3-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Read Scientific Articles Quickly Step 3 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/68/Read-Scientific-Articles-Quickly-Step-3-Version-2.jpg/aid11950526-v4-728px-Read-Scientific-Articles-Quickly-Step-3-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>For example, if you're looking for sources for a research paper, you'll know after reading the abstract if the article is related to your paper or would be potentially helpful for your thesis.</li> \n    <li>If you know you'll have to read the whole article regardless (such as if you're reading it to fulfill a course assignment), the abstract still gives you a brief overview of the whole article that you can use as a sort of map to guide your reading.</li> \n    <li>If there are any words in the abstract that you don't know, go ahead and look them up. If they appear in the abstract, you can be certain they'll appear frequently in the article. Knowing what they mean will help you read more quickly.<sup id=\"_ref-4\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 4\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Read-Scientific-Articles-Quickly#_note-4\">[4]</a></sup></li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Read-Scientific-Articles-Quickly&amp;action=edit&amp;section=3\" title=\"Edit section: Identifying the Main Points\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Identifying-the-Main-Points\">Identifying the Main Points</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Read the last paragraph or two of the \"Background\" section. The \"Background\" section thoroughly discusses the state of research and development on the topic prior to the study that gave rise to this particular article. If you're trying to read the article quickly, focus on the last paragraph, which summarizes the entire section and tells you the authors' purpose and objectives.<sup id=\"_ref-5\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 5\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Read-Scientific-Articles-Quickly#_note-5\">[5]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Read-Scientific-Articles-Quickly-Step-4-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Read Scientific Articles Quickly Step 4 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a2/Read-Scientific-Articles-Quickly-Step-4-Version-2.jpg/aid11950526-v4-728px-Read-Scientific-Articles-Quickly-Step-4-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Look for a phrase at the beginning of a paragraph similar to \"in this paper, we will.\" This is a trigger phrase that the authors are summarizing the background and explaining the objective of their research.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Answer \"who,\" \"what,\" \"when,\" \"where,\" \"why,\" and \"how.\" If you can answer these 5 questions, then you have a solid basic understanding of the article. Typically, you'll find the answers in the abstract or in the last paragraph of the \"Background\" section.<sup id=\"_ref-6\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 6\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Read-Scientific-Articles-Quickly#_note-6\">[6]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Read-Scientific-Articles-Quickly-Step-5-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Read Scientific Articles Quickly Step 5 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/77/Read-Scientific-Articles-Quickly-Step-5-Version-2.jpg/aid11950526-v4-728px-Read-Scientific-Articles-Quickly-Step-5-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>For example, suppose the article states: \"In this paper, we will show the effect on 14- to 16-year-old Brazilian boys of eating 2 apples before playing soccer in the afternoon.\" From this one sentence, you know the \"who\" (14- to 16-year-old boys), the \"what\" (eating 2 apples), the \"when\" (before playing soccer in the afternoon), and the \"where\" (Brazil).</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Highlight or underline key points of the article. Rather than reading word for word, use your understanding of the study (gleaned from the abstract or from other research) to hone in on buzzwords that indicate a particular statement is important.<sup id=\"_ref-7\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 7\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Read-Scientific-Articles-Quickly#_note-7\">[7]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Read-Scientific-Articles-Quickly-Step-6-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Read Scientific Articles Quickly Step 6 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/60/Read-Scientific-Articles-Quickly-Step-6-Version-2.jpg/aid11950526-v4-728px-Read-Scientific-Articles-Quickly-Step-6-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>For example, words such as \"found,\" \"determined,\" or \"concluded\" typically signal the results of the study or the conclusions the authors of the article reached.</li> \n    <li>In the methods section, highlight the word that describes the method used. It's usually a verb, such as \"surveyed\" or \"tested.\" You might also see a similar phrase, such as \"conducted a survey.\"</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Skim for words such as \"surprising\" or \"unexpected.\" If the authors uncovered something that went against their hypothesis or didn't follow the conventional wisdom of the field, you can expect to see words like these. Anything described this way is an important part of the article and something you should understand.<sup id=\"_ref-8\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 8\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Read-Scientific-Articles-Quickly#_note-8\">[8]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Read-Scientific-Articles-Quickly-Step-7-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Read Scientific Articles Quickly Step 7 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/33/Read-Scientific-Articles-Quickly-Step-7-Version-2.jpg/aid11950526-v4-728px-Read-Scientific-Articles-Quickly-Step-7-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If you have a digital copy of the article, do a simple word search for these words and their synonyms. Read a sentence or two after any word that pops up and make a note of it.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Take notes as you read. Taking notes ensures that you're reading actively and will help you remember the important points later. If you're reading a scientific article quickly, you're likely not reading the whole thing, which makes your notes even more important if you need to refer back to the article later.<sup id=\"_ref-9\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 9\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Read-Scientific-Articles-Quickly#_note-9\">[9]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Read-Scientific-Articles-Quickly-Step-8-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Read Scientific Articles Quickly Step 8 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/ab/Read-Scientific-Articles-Quickly-Step-8-Version-2.jpg/aid11950526-v4-728px-Read-Scientific-Articles-Quickly-Step-8-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If you know you're going to be reading multiple articles, create a single-page form with sections for the title, keywords, hypothesis, methodology, and results. You can use this form to jot down information about the article as you read.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Read-Scientific-Articles-Quickly&amp;action=edit&amp;section=4\" title=\"Edit section: Using Tables and Figures\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Using-Tables-and-Figures\">Using Tables and Figures</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Review the tables and charts in the \"Results\" section of the article. The tables and charts in a scientific article summarize all of the information that's provided in the \"Discussion\" section, enabling you to review information at a glance rather than reading through several dense pages of information. In most articles, you'll be able to understand not only the outcome of the study but also the methods the authors used to acquire the information.<sup id=\"_ref-10\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 10\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Read-Scientific-Articles-Quickly#_note-10\">[10]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Read-Scientific-Articles-Quickly-Step-9-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Read Scientific Articles Quickly Step 9 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/5d/Read-Scientific-Articles-Quickly-Step-9-Version-2.jpg/aid11950526-v4-728px-Read-Scientific-Articles-Quickly-Step-9-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Look closely at the labels and units on the axes of charts and graphs, as well as the range of values used.</li> \n    <li>The legend and footnotes help you better understand the information presented in the article's figures. Usually, they'll help you make sense of a figure that might not be clear at first glance.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Use the beginning of the \"Discussion\" section to explain the tables. If the tables don't make sense to you based on what you know about the article so far, the first 2 or 3 paragraphs of the \"Discussion\" section will help you. Here, the authors typically summarize their results and tell you how their research will potentially affect their field.<sup id=\"_ref-11\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 11\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Read-Scientific-Articles-Quickly#_note-11\">[11]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Read-Scientific-Articles-Quickly-Step-10-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Read Scientific Articles Quickly Step 10 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/5a/Read-Scientific-Articles-Quickly-Step-10-Version-2.jpg/aid11950526-v4-728px-Read-Scientific-Articles-Quickly-Step-10-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>You might also read the last paragraph of the \"Discussion\" section, particularly if it isn't obvious to you how the research discussed potentially impacts the field or populations other than the one studied. But be careful — sometimes scientists, eager for their research to seem important, make bold, exaggerated claims that aren't likely to come to fruition any time soon.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Move to the \"Methods\" section if there's anything you don't understand. If you're still not clear on how the research was conducted or have questions about how the data was gathered, you might find the \"Methods\" section helpful. The first paragraph typically provides a big-picture of the methodology used, while the following paragraphs get into more specific detail.<sup id=\"_ref-12\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 12\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Read-Scientific-Articles-Quickly#_note-12\">[12]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Read-Scientific-Articles-Quickly-Step-11-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Read Scientific Articles Quickly Step 11 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c0/Read-Scientific-Articles-Quickly-Step-11-Version-2.jpg/aid11950526-v4-728px-Read-Scientific-Articles-Quickly-Step-11-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>This section can get very technical. Unless you have some reason to know the specifics for how the particular study was conducted, there's likely no reason for you to read it in depth.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Read-Scientific-Articles-Quickly&amp;action=edit&amp;section=5\" title=\"Edit section: Tips\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Tips\">Tips</span></h2> \n <ul>\n  <li>Read scientific articles often, for your own education or enlightenment. If you read scientific articles regularly, you'll become familiar with the structure and be able to read more quickly.<sup id=\"_ref-13\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 13\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Read-Scientific-Articles-Quickly#_note-13\">[13]</a></sup></li>\n </ul> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Read-Scientific-Articles-Quickly&amp;action=edit&amp;section=6\" title=\"Edit section: References\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"References\">References</span></h2>\n <div class=\"mw-references-wrap mw-references-columns\">\n  <ol class=\"references\"> \n   <li id=\"_note-1\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Read-Scientific-Articles-Quickly#_ref-1\">↑</a> <span +0000","feedId":44,"bgimg":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/72/Read-Scientific-Articles-Quickly-Step-1-Version-3.jpg/aid11950526-v4-728px-Read-Scientific-Articles-Quickly-Step-1-Version-3.jpg","linkMd5":"ad405fcf78bf0c835f54cc86019557dc","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn43@2020_4/2020/09/16/05-03-48-172_e5f8dc69caa922d8.webp","destWidth":728,"destHeight":546,"sourceBytes":78125,"destBytes":38038,"author":"","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/72/Read-Scientific-Articles-Quickly-Step-1-Version-3.jpg/aid11950526-v4-728px-Read-Scientific-Articles-Quickly-Step-1-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn43@2020_4/2020/09/16/05-03-48-172_e5f8dc69caa922d8.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/19/Read-Scientific-Articles-Quickly-Step-2-Version-2.jpg/aid11950526-v4-728px-Read-Scientific-Articles-Quickly-Step-2-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn83@2020_4/2020/09/16/05-04-12-151_9857b15156fc401e.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/68/Read-Scientific-Articles-Quickly-Step-3-Version-2.jpg/aid11950526-v4-728px-Read-Scientific-Articles-Quickly-Step-3-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn56@2020_4/2020/09/16/05-04-06-219_cfeafc624367cc1a.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a2/Read-Scientific-Articles-Quickly-Step-4-Version-2.jpg/aid11950526-v4-728px-Read-Scientific-Articles-Quickly-Step-4-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn64@2020_1/2020/09/16/05-04-13-385_cfdb09e8481423c1.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/77/Read-Scientific-Articles-Quickly-Step-5-Version-2.jpg/aid11950526-v4-728px-Read-Scientific-Articles-Quickly-Step-5-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn72@2020_6/2020/09/16/05-04-10-361_3135c670453624b3.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/60/Read-Scientific-Articles-Quickly-Step-6-Version-2.jpg/aid11950526-v4-728px-Read-Scientific-Articles-Quickly-Step-6-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn48@2020_3/2020/09/16/05-04-11-390_340dbc68d3911b08.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/33/Read-Scientific-Articles-Quickly-Step-7-Version-2.jpg/aid11950526-v4-728px-Read-Scientific-Articles-Quickly-Step-7-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn60@2020_6/2020/09/16/05-04-08-464_6e5502c05b900b17.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/ab/Read-Scientific-Articles-Quickly-Step-8-Version-2.jpg/aid11950526-v4-728px-Read-Scientific-Articles-Quickly-Step-8-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn72@2020_1/2020/09/16/05-04-12-619_f2750ca022b0556e.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/5d/Read-Scientific-Articles-Quickly-Step-9-Version-2.jpg/aid11950526-v4-728px-Read-Scientific-Articles-Quickly-Step-9-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn51@2020_4/2020/09/16/05-04-10-957_ce796f6b5b0caee9.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/5a/Read-Scientific-Articles-Quickly-Step-10-Version-2.jpg/aid11950526-v4-728px-Read-Scientific-Articles-Quickly-Step-10-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn59@2020_3/2020/09/16/05-04-10-323_135d7466b68c698b.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c0/Read-Scientific-Articles-Quickly-Step-11-Version-2.jpg/aid11950526-v4-728px-Read-Scientific-Articles-Quickly-Step-11-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn48@2020_4/2020/09/16/05-04-11-902_32ad5b2bac797388.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1600232627599},{"createdTime":"2020-09-16 13:03:47","updatedTime":"2020-09-16 13:03:47","title":"How to Recover Google Chrome Passwords","link":"https://www.wikihow.com/Recover-Google-Chrome-Passwords","description":"<div class=\"mw-parser-output\">\n <p>This wikiHow will teach you how to find your saved passwords in Google Chrome using Password Manager. Unfortunately, there is no way to recover passwords that you delete in Google Chrome. </p> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Recover-Google-Chrome-Passwords&amp;action=edit&amp;section=1\" title=\"Edit section: Steps\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Steps\">Steps</span></h2> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Recover-Google-Chrome-Passwords&amp;action=edit&amp;section=2\" title=\"Edit section: Using a Desktop Computer\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Using-a-Desktop-Computer\">Using a Desktop Computer</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Open Google Chrome . You'll find this app icon in your Start menu or in the Applications folder of Finder.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Recover-Google-Chrome-Passwords-Step-1.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Recover Google Chrome Passwords Step 1.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/13/Recover-Google-Chrome-Passwords-Step-1.jpg/aid12090346-v4-728px-Recover-Google-Chrome-Passwords-Step-1.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Click . It's in the top right corner of the window.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Recover-Google-Chrome-Passwords-Step-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Recover Google Chrome Passwords Step 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a8/Recover-Google-Chrome-Passwords-Step-2.jpg/aid12090346-v4-728px-Recover-Google-Chrome-Passwords-Step-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Click . This is usually toward the bottom of the menu.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Recover-Google-Chrome-Passwords-Step-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Recover Google Chrome Passwords Step 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/4e/Recover-Google-Chrome-Passwords-Step-3.jpg/aid12090346-v4-728px-Recover-Google-Chrome-Passwords-Step-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Click . It's in the menu on the left side of the page.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Recover-Google-Chrome-Passwords-Step-4.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Recover Google Chrome Passwords Step 4.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/28/Recover-Google-Chrome-Passwords-Step-4.jpg/aid12090346-v4-728px-Recover-Google-Chrome-Passwords-Step-4.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Click . This is usually the first option in the menu.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Recover-Google-Chrome-Passwords-Step-5.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Recover Google Chrome Passwords Step 5.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e6/Recover-Google-Chrome-Passwords-Step-5.jpg/aid12090346-v4-728px-Recover-Google-Chrome-Passwords-Step-5.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Click the eye icon next to the website with the associated password you want to see and enter your computer password. If you enter your computer's password correctly, the eye icon will show your password for the site.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Recover-Google-Chrome-Passwords-Step-6.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Recover Google Chrome Passwords Step 6.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b6/Recover-Google-Chrome-Passwords-Step-6.jpg/aid12090346-v4-728px-Recover-Google-Chrome-Passwords-Step-6.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>You can repeat this step for each site with a password you want to see. <sup id=\"_ref-1\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 1\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Recover-Google-Chrome-Passwords#_note-1\">[1]</a></sup></li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Recover-Google-Chrome-Passwords&amp;action=edit&amp;section=3\" title=\"Edit section: Using Android\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Using-Android\">Using Android</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Open Google Chrome . You'll find this on one of your Home screens, in the app drawer, or by searching.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Recover-Google-Chrome-Passwords-Step-7.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Recover Google Chrome Passwords Step 7.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/1f/Recover-Google-Chrome-Passwords-Step-7.jpg/aid12090346-v4-728px-Recover-Google-Chrome-Passwords-Step-7.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Tap . It's in the top right corner of the window next to the address bar.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Recover-Google-Chrome-Passwords-Step-8.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Recover Google Chrome Passwords Step 8.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/74/Recover-Google-Chrome-Passwords-Step-8.jpg/aid12090346-v4-728px-Recover-Google-Chrome-Passwords-Step-8.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Tap . This is usually toward the bottom of the menu.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Recover-Google-Chrome-Passwords-Step-9.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Recover Google Chrome Passwords Step 9.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b1/Recover-Google-Chrome-Passwords-Step-9.jpg/aid12090346-v4-728px-Recover-Google-Chrome-Passwords-Step-9.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Tap . You'll find this menu option near the middle of your screen.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Recover-Google-Chrome-Passwords-Step-10.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Recover Google Chrome Passwords Step 10.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/99/Recover-Google-Chrome-Passwords-Step-10.jpg/aid12090346-v4-728px-Recover-Google-Chrome-Passwords-Step-10.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Tap a password you want to see. From the list of websites that have usernames and passwords, you'll be able to tap on one to see more information about that login.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Recover-Google-Chrome-Passwords-Step-11.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Recover Google Chrome Passwords Step 11.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a5/Recover-Google-Chrome-Passwords-Step-11.jpg/aid12090346-v4-728px-Recover-Google-Chrome-Passwords-Step-11.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Tap the eye icon next to the password and enter your phone's security code. This could also be worded as a PIN or your fingerprint, but after you enter the code correctly, you'll be able to see the password.<sup id=\"_ref-2\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 2\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Recover-Google-Chrome-Passwords#_note-2\">[2]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Recover-Google-Chrome-Passwords-Step-12.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Recover Google Chrome Passwords Step 12.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/97/Recover-Google-Chrome-Passwords-Step-12.jpg/aid12090346-v4-728px-Recover-Google-Chrome-Passwords-Step-12.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Recover-Google-Chrome-Passwords&amp;action=edit&amp;section=4\" title=\"Edit section: Using an iPhone or iPad\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Using-an-iPhone-or-iPad\">Using an iPhone or iPad</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Open Google Chrome . You'll find this red, green, yellow, and blue orb on one of your Home screens.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Recover-Google-Chrome-Passwords-Step-13.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Recover Google Chrome Passwords Step 13.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/94/Recover-Google-Chrome-Passwords-Step-13.jpg/aid12090346-v4-728px-Recover-Google-Chrome-Passwords-Step-13.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Tap . It's in the bottom right corner of your screen (iPhone) or top right (horizontal iPad).\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Recover-Google-Chrome-Passwords-Step-14.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Recover Google Chrome Passwords Step 14.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/03/Recover-Google-Chrome-Passwords-Step-14.jpg/aid12090346-v4-728px-Recover-Google-Chrome-Passwords-Step-14.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Tap . This is next to an icon of a gear near the bottom of the menu.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Recover-Google-Chrome-Passwords-Step-15.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Recover Google Chrome Passwords Step 15.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/80/Recover-Google-Chrome-Passwords-Step-15.jpg/aid12090346-v4-728px-Recover-Google-Chrome-Passwords-Step-15.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Tap . You'll then see a list of all your passwords for all your logins.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Recover-Google-Chrome-Passwords-Step-16.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Recover Google Chrome Passwords Step 16.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/0a/Recover-Google-Chrome-Passwords-Step-16.jpg/aid12090346-v4-728px-Recover-Google-Chrome-Passwords-Step-16.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Tap under a password you want to see. Your default view of you passwords is hidden, so you'll need to request to see them for each login.<sup id=\"_ref-3\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 3\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Recover-Google-Chrome-Passwords#_note-3\">[3]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Recover-Google-Chrome-Passwords-Step-17.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Recover Google Chrome Passwords Step 17.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/1a/Recover-Google-Chrome-Passwords-Step-17.jpg/aid12090346-v4-728px-Recover-Google-Chrome-Passwords-Step-17.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li>\n </ol> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Recover-Google-Chrome-Passwords&amp;action=edit&amp;section=5\" title=\"Edit section: Tips\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Tips\">Tips</span></h2> \n <ul>\n  <li>You can also go to <a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://passwords.google.com\">https://passwords.google.com</a> if you're unable to see passwords in your settings.</li> \n  <li>If you still can't find your passwords in Chrome by using Password Manager, you can check for a backup.<sup id=\"_ref-4\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 4\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Recover-Google-Chrome-Passwords#_note-4\">[4]</a></sup></li>\n </ul> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Recover-Google-Chrome-Passwords&amp;action=edit&amp;section=6\" title=\"Edit section: References\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"References\">References</span></h2> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Recover-Google-Chrome-Passwords&amp;action=edit&amp;section=7\" title=\"Edit section: Quick Summary\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Quick-Summary\">Quick Summary</span></h2>\n <div class=\"mw-references-wrap\">\n  <ol \n</div>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Sat, 12 Sep 2020 08:00:00 +0000","feedId":44,"bgimg":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/13/Recover-Google-Chrome-Passwords-Step-1.jpg/aid12090346-v4-728px-Recover-Google-Chrome-Passwords-Step-1.jpg","linkMd5":"3a49d6bc09fd5605ced9c2481e3b86bd","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn32@2020_6/2020/09/16/05-03-47-970_ad676cab6ecf189f.webp","destWidth":728,"destHeight":546,"sourceBytes":35908,"destBytes":19948,"author":"","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/13/Recover-Google-Chrome-Passwords-Step-1.jpg/aid12090346-v4-728px-Recover-Google-Chrome-Passwords-Step-1.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn32@2020_6/2020/09/16/05-03-47-970_ad676cab6ecf189f.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a8/Recover-Google-Chrome-Passwords-Step-2.jpg/aid12090346-v4-728px-Recover-Google-Chrome-Passwords-Step-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn56@2020_3/2020/09/16/05-04-11-144_29a62a5fa9242fd8.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/4e/Recover-Google-Chrome-Passwords-Step-3.jpg/aid12090346-v4-728px-Recover-Google-Chrome-Passwords-Step-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn49@2020_6/2020/09/16/05-04-07-457_f754b056eb7498fc.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/28/Recover-Google-Chrome-Passwords-Step-4.jpg/aid12090346-v4-728px-Recover-Google-Chrome-Passwords-Step-4.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn25@2020_3/2020/09/16/05-04-07-337_22a892cce35f1082.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e6/Recover-Google-Chrome-Passwords-Step-5.jpg/aid12090346-v4-728px-Recover-Google-Chrome-Passwords-Step-5.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn27@2020_3/2020/09/16/05-04-08-931_901f2d013d57d1b4.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b6/Recover-Google-Chrome-Passwords-Step-6.jpg/aid12090346-v4-728px-Recover-Google-Chrome-Passwords-Step-6.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn39@2020_1/2020/09/16/05-04-09-987_23c55ab48bb469e5.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/1f/Recover-Google-Chrome-Passwords-Step-7.jpg/aid12090346-v4-728px-Recover-Google-Chrome-Passwords-Step-7.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn75@2020_4/2020/09/16/05-04-07-523_9702b30f73812133.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/74/Recover-Google-Chrome-Passwords-Step-8.jpg/aid12090346-v4-728px-Recover-Google-Chrome-Passwords-Step-8.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn99@2020_3/2020/09/16/05-04-09-723_9d5b7c43b25c36fe.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b1/Recover-Google-Chrome-Passwords-Step-9.jpg/aid12090346-v4-728px-Recover-Google-Chrome-Passwords-Step-9.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn39@2020_1/2020/09/16/05-04-06-249_bbf093bddd9821c8.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/99/Recover-Google-Chrome-Passwords-Step-10.jpg/aid12090346-v4-728px-Recover-Google-Chrome-Passwords-Step-10.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn36@2020_2/2020/09/16/05-04-10-855_2826bc4792657379.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a5/Recover-Google-Chrome-Passwords-Step-11.jpg/aid12090346-v4-728px-Recover-Google-Chrome-Passwords-Step-11.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn44@2020_1/2020/09/16/05-04-09-231_f92ea19bde88f2ab.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/97/Recover-Google-Chrome-Passwords-Step-12.jpg/aid12090346-v4-728px-Recover-Google-Chrome-Passwords-Step-12.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn87@2020_3/2020/09/16/05-04-12-785_ca866eaa8ee2f1e3.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/94/Recover-Google-Chrome-Passwords-Step-13.jpg/aid12090346-v4-728px-Recover-Google-Chrome-Passwords-Step-13.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn94@2020_1/2020/09/16/05-04-06-181_4740011f27d685c8.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/03/Recover-Google-Chrome-Passwords-Step-14.jpg/aid12090346-v4-728px-Recover-Google-Chrome-Passwords-Step-14.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn8@2020_6/2020/09/16/05-04-11-459_9144f6f8c238389f.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/80/Recover-Google-Chrome-Passwords-Step-15.jpg/aid12090346-v4-728px-Recover-Google-Chrome-Passwords-Step-15.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn19@2020_3/2020/09/16/05-04-11-680_a6bb1275e6a497f6.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/0a/Recover-Google-Chrome-Passwords-Step-16.jpg/aid12090346-v4-728px-Recover-Google-Chrome-Passwords-Step-16.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn89@2020_3/2020/09/16/05-04-22-274_e97d0b8ed4ba48fa.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/1a/Recover-Google-Chrome-Passwords-Step-17.jpg/aid12090346-v4-728px-Recover-Google-Chrome-Passwords-Step-17.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn60@2020_2/2020/09/16/05-04-11-922_0df3b6f9a02a39df.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1600232627607},{"createdTime":"2020-09-16 13:03:47","updatedTime":"2020-09-16 13:03:47","title":"How to Grow a Beard Faster","link":"https://www.wikihow.com/Grow-a-Beard-Faster","description":"<div class=\"mw-parser-output\">\n <p>If you're eager to grow a glorious beard, it's hard to accept that it simply takes time. In reality, your genetic profile is the most important (and unchangeable) factor in how fast your beard will grow.<sup id=\"_ref-1\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 1\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Grow-a-Beard-Faster#_note-1\">[1]</a></sup> There are things you can do to potentially speed up the process a bit, though. Take care of your beard as it grows, follow a beard-healthy lifestyle, and talk to your doctor if your beard needs additional help. And, above all, be patient, and don’t stress! </p> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Grow-a-Beard-Faster&amp;action=edit&amp;section=1\" title=\"Edit section: Steps\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Steps\">Steps</span></h2> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Grow-a-Beard-Faster&amp;action=edit&amp;section=2\" title=\"Edit section: Caring for Your Face and Beard\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Caring-for-Your-Face-and-Beard\">Caring for Your Face and Beard</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Be patient and let your facial hair grow. Your genetic profile is the primary factor in how quickly (and how fully) your beard grows, and there’s not much you can do about that. On average, though, most people will see their facial hair fully grow in after 4 weeks of not shaving.<sup id=\"_ref-2\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 2\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Grow-a-Beard-Faster#_note-2\">[2]</a></sup>While you can take measures to support the process and <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Increase-Facial-Hair-Growth\" title=\"Increase Facial Hair Growth\">increase the growth</a>, you should also accept that your beard will grow in its own way and at its own pace.<sup id=\"_ref-3\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 3\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Grow-a-Beard-Faster#_note-3\">[3]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Grow-a-Beard-Faster-Step-1-Version-4.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Grow a Beard Faster Step 1 Version 4.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c6/Grow-a-Beard-Faster-Step-1-Version-4.jpg/aid2670008-v4-728px-Grow-a-Beard-Faster-Step-1-Version-4.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Some people say that regularly trimming your beard will stimulate faster growth, but there’s no evidence to support this.</li> \n    <li>It’s possible that frequent shaving before you start growing a beard may stimulate the hair follicles to grow faster, but the evidence for this is also limited at best.<sup id=\"_ref-4\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 4\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Grow-a-Beard-Faster#_note-4\">[4]</a></sup></li> \n    <li>So, once you start growing a beard, just let it grow!</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Wash your face twice per day to unblock hair follicles. Wet your face with warm water. If you haven’t started your beard yet, massage in a gentle face cleanser. If you do have a beard coming in, also use a mild shampoo on just the facial hair. Rinse the cleanser and/or shampoo away with cool, clean water, then pat your face dry with a soft towel. Do this every morning and evening.<sup id=\"_ref-5\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 5\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Grow-a-Beard-Faster#_note-5\">[5]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Grow-a-Beard-Faster-Step-2-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Grow a Beard Faster Step 2 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/31/Grow-a-Beard-Faster-Step-2-Version-3.jpg/aid2670008-v4-728px-Grow-a-Beard-Faster-Step-2-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Washing your face regularly will help to remove dirt and oil from your hair follicles. This makes it easier for them to grow.</li> \n    <li>To test if a cleanser is gentle enough for your skin, apply a small amount to your chin and leave it for 10 minutes. If you don't have any signs of a reaction (like redness or irritation), you can try washing your face with the cleanser.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Massage your face twice daily to stimulate the follicles. Apply firm but not painful pressure on your face with your fingertips, then massage in small circles over your beard-growing area. Do the massage for about 10 minutes, twice per day.<sup id=\"_ref-6\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 6\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Grow-a-Beard-Faster#_note-6\">[6]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Grow-a-Beard-Faster-Step-3-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Grow a Beard Faster Step 3 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f2/Grow-a-Beard-Faster-Step-3-Version-3.jpg/aid2670008-v4-728px-Grow-a-Beard-Faster-Step-3-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Exfoliate-Your-Face\" title=\"Exfoliate Your Face\">Exfoliate your face</a> once per week.<sup id=\"_ref-7\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 7\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Grow-a-Beard-Faster#_note-7\">[7]</a></sup> Wash your face as normal with your gentle cleanser or shampoo, but rinse with warm water and leave your skin damp. Gently massage in the exfoliant over your entire face (including any facial hair), then rinse it away completely with clean water and pat your face dry.<sup id=\"_ref-8\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 8\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Grow-a-Beard-Faster#_note-8\">[8]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Grow-a-Beard-Faster-Step-4-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Grow a Beard Faster Step 4 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/ed/Grow-a-Beard-Faster-Step-4-Version-3.jpg/aid2670008-v4-728px-Grow-a-Beard-Faster-Step-4-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Exfoliating will help to clear away dead skin cells that may be impeding your hair follicles from achieving their full growth potential.</li> \n    <li>Before using an exfoliant on your entire face, test a small patch on your chin for 5-10 minutes. If you don’t feel any burning or irritation, you should be good to go.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Pamper your growing beard with beard oil or softener. While you should be wary of any product claims made for stimulating beard growth, beard oils and beard softeners may, in fact, provide some benefits. Keeping your beard hairs soft and hydrated may encourage slightly faster growth.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Grow-a-Beard-Faster-Step-5-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Grow a Beard Faster Step 5 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/ba/Grow-a-Beard-Faster-Step-5-Version-3.jpg/aid2670008-v4-728px-Grow-a-Beard-Faster-Step-5-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Avoid beard oil if you have acne, though. It may worsen your breakouts.<sup id=\"_ref-9\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 9\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Grow-a-Beard-Faster#_note-9\">[9]</a></sup></li> \n    <li>At the very least, using beard products will make your beard look and feel better, no matter how fast it’s growing.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Try homemade beard-stimulating recipes. As with most home remedies, the supporting evidence for beard stimulators is limited at best. They aren’t likely to cause any harm, though, so consider trying one or both of the following:<sup id=\"_ref-10\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 10\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Grow-a-Beard-Faster#_note-10\">[10]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Grow-a-Beard-Faster-Step-6-Version-4.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Grow a Beard Faster Step 6 Version 4.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b4/Grow-a-Beard-Faster-Step-6-Version-4.jpg/aid2670008-v4-728px-Grow-a-Beard-Faster-Step-6-Version-4.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Create a thin paste out of of fresh-squeezed lime juice and 1 US tbsp (15 g) of ground cinnamon. Apply it to your beard in a thin layer, leave it for 20-30 minutes, then rinse it away and use your normal face cleanser. Use this paste 1-2 times per day, but stop if you notice any irritation.</li> \n    <li>Blend 3 US tbsp (45 g) of dried mustard leaves with of amla oil until it forms a smooth paste. Apply it in a thin layer over your beard, leave it for 15-20 minutes, then rinse it away and wash your face with your normal cleanser. Refrigerate any remaining paste and use it daily for 2-3 days.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Grow-a-Beard-Faster&amp;action=edit&amp;section=3\" title=\"Edit section: Choosing a Beard-Friendly Diet and Lifestyle\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Choosing-a-Beard-Friendly-Diet-and-Lifestyle\">Choosing a Beard-Friendly Diet and Lifestyle</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Eat more foods with vitamins B3, B5, B7, and B9. Several of the B vitamins promote healthy hair, so upping your intake may help your beard grow a bit faster and fuller. Biotin (Vitamin B7) seems particularly beneficial, so you may want to consult your doctor about taking a biotin supplement as well.<sup id=\"_ref-11\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 11\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Grow-a-Beard-Faster#_note-11\">[11]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Grow-a-Beard-Faster-Step-7-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Grow a Beard Faster Step 7 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/5b/Grow-a-Beard-Faster-Step-7-Version-3.jpg/aid2670008-v4-728px-Grow-a-Beard-Faster-Step-7-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Nuts are a great source of biotin (Vitamin B7).</li> \n    <li>You’ll find vitamins B3 and B5 in chicken, beef, fish, dairy, and avocados.</li> \n    <li>You can get Vitamin B9 from cereals, nuts, and leafy greens.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Increase your intake of vitamins A, C, and E. Like the B vitamins, each of these vitamins supports healthy hair in some fashion. They’re also important for your overall health.<sup id=\"_ref-12\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 12\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Grow-a-Beard-Faster#_note-12\">[12]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Grow-a-Beard-Faster-Step-8-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Grow a Beard Faster Step 8 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/26/Grow-a-Beard-Faster-Step-8-Version-3.jpg/aid2670008-v4-728px-Grow-a-Beard-Faster-Step-8-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Eat carrots, broccoli, and leafy greens for Vitamin A.</li> \n    <li>Choose green peppers, tomatoes, and citrus for Vitamin C.</li> \n    <li>Pick beans, nuts, and leafy greens for Vitamin E.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Eat a <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Eat-Healthy\" title=\"Eat Healthy\">balanced diet</a> overall to support beard health. While it may be helpful to target key vitamins, make sure you focus on eating a healthy diet that provides a wide variety of nutrients. Think of it this way—whatever is good for your body is good for your beard!<sup id=\"_ref-13\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 13\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Grow-a-Beard-Faster#_note-13\">[13]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Grow-a-Beard-Faster-Step-9-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Grow a Beard Faster Step 9 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/29/Grow-a-Beard-Faster-Step-9-Version-3.jpg/aid2670008-v4-728px-Grow-a-Beard-Faster-Step-9-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Eat lots of vegetables, fruits, whole grains, lean proteins, and healthy fats (like avocados and olive oil).</li> \n    <li>Cut back on processed foods, excess salt and sugar, and unhealthy fats (like saturated and trans fats in processed foods).</li> \n    <li><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Drink-Enough-Water\" title=\"Drink Enough Water\">Drink water</a> to hydrate your body and your beard hair follicles.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Follow health guidelines for exercise and sleep. Like eating a healthy diet, getting enough exercise and enough sleep are good for your overall health and your beard health. Aim for the following:<sup id=\"_ref-14\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 14\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Grow-a-Beard-Faster#_note-14\">[14]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Grow-a-Beard-Faster-Step-10-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Grow a Beard Faster Step 10 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/72/Grow-a-Beard-Faster-Step-10-Version-3.jpg/aid2670008-v4-728px-Grow-a-Beard-Faster-Step-10-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Get at least 150 minutes of moderate-intensity aerobic <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Choose-an-Exercise-Program\" title=\"Choose an Exercise Program\">exercise</a> per week. Moderate intensity means your heart rate is elevated and you’re breathing hard enough that it’s tough to make conversation.</li> \n    <li>Do 2-3 <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Increase-Upper-Body-Strength\" title=\"Increase Upper Body Strength\">strength training</a> sessions per week, each for 30-60 minutes.</li> \n    <li>Get roughly 8 hours of uninterrupted <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Sleep-Better\" title=\"Sleep Better\">sleep</a> at night.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Relieve-Stress\" title=\"Relieve Stress\">Reduce stress</a> to encourage beard growth. You’ve probably heard that excessive stress can cause hair loss. It shouldn’t be surprising, then, that it might also slow down hair growth. That means the less you worry about your beard, the better it might grow!<sup id=\"_ref-15\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 15\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Grow-a-Beard-Faster#_note-15\">[15]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Grow-a-Beard-Faster-Step-11-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Grow a Beard Faster Step 11 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/86/Grow-a-Beard-Faster-Step-11-Version-3.jpg/aid2670008-v4-728px-Grow-a-Beard-Faster-Step-11-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Find the stress reduction techniques that work best for you. Try things like yoga, meditation, deep breathing, progressive muscle relaxation, nature walks, listening to calming music, talking to friends, or reading a good book.</li> \n    <li>Work with your doctor and a mental health professional if you're having significant difficulty handling stress.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Quit-Smoking\" title=\"Quit Smoking\">Stop smoking</a> for your overall (and maybe beard) health. There’s no direct evidence that smoking is specifically bad for beard health. However, smoking is clearly bad for so many aspects of your overall health that it's not unreasonable to think it may hinder beard growth. Whether you're trying to grow a beard or not, focus on quitting as soon as possible.<sup id=\"_ref-16\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 16\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Grow-a-Beard-Faster#_note-16\">[16]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Grow-a-Beard-Faster-Step-12-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Grow a Beard Faster Step 12 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/22/Grow-a-Beard-Faster-Step-12-Version-3.jpg/aid2670008-v4-728px-Grow-a-Beard-Faster-Step-12-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>There are numerous <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Choose-the-Best-Stop-Smoking-Aid\" title=\"Choose the Best Stop Smoking Aid\">smoking cessation aids</a> available today. Work with your doctor to find the right method (or combination of methods) for you.</li> \n    <li>There is some evidence that smoking may cause your beard hair to turn gray faster.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Grow-a-Beard-Faster&amp;action=edit&amp;section=4\" title=\"Edit section: Considering Medical Options\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Considering-Medical-Options\">Considering Medical Options</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Seek medical advice regarding your testosterone and DHT levels. Testosterone can be broken up into 2 types, often referred to as T and DHT. DHT levels impact beard hair density, while T impacts beard hair thickness. Managing T and DHT levels under medical supervision may enhance your beard growth.<sup id=\"_ref-17\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 17\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Grow-a-Beard-Faster#_note-17\">[17]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Grow-a-Beard-Faster-Step-13-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Grow a Beard Faster Step 13 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e8/Grow-a-Beard-Faster-Step-13-Version-3.jpg/aid2670008-v4-728px-Grow-a-Beard-Faster-Step-13-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Do not use testosterone-boosting pills, creams, injections, or other products without the advice and guidance of your doctor. There can be a range of unwanted side effects, and you could end up impeding beard growth.</li> \n    <li>Your doctor may recommend engaging in regular strength-training sessions as a way to naturally boost testosterone levels.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Talk to your doctor about using minoxidil (Rogaine) on your face. Rogaine, the most common brand name for minoxidil, is widely used to slow the progress of male pattern baldness. If applied to the face properly, it should help stimulate beard growth. However, even though Rogaine is available over the counter in many areas, you should always consult your doctor before using it on your face.<sup id=\"_ref-18\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 18\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Grow-a-Beard-Faster#_note-18\">[18]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Grow-a-Beard-Faster-Step-14-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Grow a Beard Faster Step 14 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f3/Grow-a-Beard-Faster-Step-14-Version-2.jpg/aid2670008-v4-728px-Grow-a-Beard-Faster-Step-14-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>This may be a better treatment option if you have patches where your beard doesn’t grow in well, as opposed to wanting your entire beard to grow in faster.</li> \n    <li>If and when you stop treatment, any new hair growth may fall out.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Ask a medical expert about micro-needling to stimulate hair growth. Microneedling involves rolling a device on your face that’s similar to a lint roller—except instead of sticky paper on the roller, it has hundreds of tiny needle points. Some advocates for micro-needling believe the tiny pinpricks stimulate the hair follicles and enhance beard growth.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Grow-a-Beard-Faster-Step-15.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Grow a Beard Faster Step 15.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/03/Grow-a-Beard-Faster-Step-15.jpg/aid2670008-v4-728px-Grow-a-Beard-Faster-Step-15.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Some dermatologists and cosmetic surgeons use in-office micro-needling to address issues like acne. Talk to a medical professional you trust before undergoing micro-needling treatments or buying a device yourself.<sup id=\"_ref-19\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 19\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Grow-a-Beard-Faster#_note-19\">[19]</a></sup></li> \n    <li>If used correctly, the process should be safe and relatively painless. However, it’s essential that the device is sanitized properly before each use according to the product instructions (usually by soaking it in alcohol).</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Look into facial hair transplants as a final option. If there are areas of your beard that simply won’t grow in, hair transplants may be your only choice. As with top-of-the-head hair transplants, individual hair follicles are relocated from one area (like the back of the neck) to another (like your cheek).<sup id=\"_ref-20\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 20\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Grow-a-Beard-Faster#_note-20\">[20]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Grow-a-Beard-Faster-Step-16.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Grow a Beard Faster Step 16.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/0e/Grow-a-Beard-Faster-Step-16.jpg/aid2670008-v4-728px-Grow-a-Beard-Faster-Step-16.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Hair transplants usually require multiple procedures that are both costly and time-consuming. It may take up to 2 years to see the full results, and the procedure doesn’t always work.</li> \n    <li>Transplants may help fill in gaps in your beard, but it won’t make your beard grow faster.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Grow-a-Beard-Faster&amp;action=edit&amp;section=5\" title=\"Edit section: Video\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Video\">Video</span></h2> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Grow-a-Beard-Faster&amp;action=edit&amp;section=6\" title=\"Edit section: Tips\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Tips\">Tips</span></h2> \n <ul>\n  <li>Remember to be patient and persistent. You can encourage your beard to grow faster, but your genetics will play a large role in how quickly the facial hair grows. Look at the beards your male relatives have; that will help you figure out what you can expect.</li>\n </ul> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Grow-a-Beard-Faster&amp;action=edit&amp;section=7\" title=\"Edit section: References\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"References\">References</span></h2> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Grow-a-Beard-Faster&amp;action=edit&amp;section=8\" title=\"Edit section: Quick Summary\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Quick-Summary\">Quick Summary</span></h2>\n <div class=\"mw-references-wrap mw-references-columns\">\n  <ol class=\"references\"> \n   <li id=\"_note-1\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Grow-a-Beard-Faster#_ref-1\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a href=\"https://www.yalemedicine.org/stories/beard-mustache-skin-problems/\">https://www.yalemedicine.org/stories/beard-mustache-skin-problems/</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-2\"><a href=\"https://www.yalemedicine.org/stories/beard-mustache-skin-problems/\">https://www.yalemedicine.org/stories/beard-mustache-skin-problems/</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-4\"><a class=\"external free\" href=\"https://wisebeards.com/beards/how-to-grow-beard/#grow-beard\">https://wisebeards.com/beards/how-to-grow-beard/#grow-beard</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-7\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Grow-a-Beard-Faster#_ref-8\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://wisebeards.com/beards/how-to-grow-beard/#grow-beard\">https://wisebeards.com/beards/how-to-grow-beard/#grow-beard</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-9\"><a target=\"_blank\" class=\"external free\" </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-16\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Grow-a-Beard-Faster#_ref-16\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-17\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Grow-a-Beard-Faster#_ref-17\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer
