\n</div>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Sat, 12 Sep 2020 00:00:00 +0000","feedId":44,"bgimg":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c6/Grow-a-Beard-Faster-Step-1-Version-4.jpg/aid2670008-v4-728px-Grow-a-Beard-Faster-Step-1-Version-4.jpg","linkMd5":"03f8de05f152d7742dcdf007fd6e42c2","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn14@2020_3/2020/09/16/05-03-48-078_3537ac27680be107.webp","destWidth":728,"destHeight":546,"sourceBytes":72388,"destBytes":47080,"author":"","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c6/Grow-a-Beard-Faster-Step-1-Version-4.jpg/aid2670008-v4-728px-Grow-a-Beard-Faster-Step-1-Version-4.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn14@2020_3/2020/09/16/05-03-48-078_3537ac27680be107.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/31/Grow-a-Beard-Faster-Step-2-Version-3.jpg/aid2670008-v4-728px-Grow-a-Beard-Faster-Step-2-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn8@2020_1/2020/09/16/05-04-09-824_63f94962d77ade03.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f2/Grow-a-Beard-Faster-Step-3-Version-3.jpg/aid2670008-v4-728px-Grow-a-Beard-Faster-Step-3-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn35@2020_6/2020/09/16/05-04-08-693_9d21759aa56039dd.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/ed/Grow-a-Beard-Faster-Step-4-Version-3.jpg/aid2670008-v4-728px-Grow-a-Beard-Faster-Step-4-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn63@2020_5/2020/09/16/05-04-12-083_9671b7ddb1ba169e.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/ba/Grow-a-Beard-Faster-Step-5-Version-3.jpg/aid2670008-v4-728px-Grow-a-Beard-Faster-Step-5-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn61@2020_5/2020/09/16/05-04-06-216_4939643f7a3af5c1.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b4/Grow-a-Beard-Faster-Step-6-Version-4.jpg/aid2670008-v4-728px-Grow-a-Beard-Faster-Step-6-Version-4.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn56@2020_3/2020/09/16/05-04-10-248_699e9b923ad0d7c5.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/5b/Grow-a-Beard-Faster-Step-7-Version-3.jpg/aid2670008-v4-728px-Grow-a-Beard-Faster-Step-7-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn79@2020_4/2020/09/16/05-04-07-257_10e3a41e93ef4f15.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/26/Grow-a-Beard-Faster-Step-8-Version-3.jpg/aid2670008-v4-728px-Grow-a-Beard-Faster-Step-8-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn75@2020_2/2020/09/16/05-04-12-159_e00fb844417a4203.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/29/Grow-a-Beard-Faster-Step-9-Version-3.jpg/aid2670008-v4-728px-Grow-a-Beard-Faster-Step-9-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn75@2020_3/2020/09/16/05-04-11-834_0c5b9848bf2e1f9f.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/72/Grow-a-Beard-Faster-Step-10-Version-3.jpg/aid2670008-v4-728px-Grow-a-Beard-Faster-Step-10-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn15@2020_3/2020/09/16/05-04-07-336_ea2c7b4aa149803f.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/86/Grow-a-Beard-Faster-Step-11-Version-3.jpg/aid2670008-v4-728px-Grow-a-Beard-Faster-Step-11-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn44@2020_2/2020/09/16/05-04-06-169_6c6490a6d317ecba.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/22/Grow-a-Beard-Faster-Step-12-Version-3.jpg/aid2670008-v4-728px-Grow-a-Beard-Faster-Step-12-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn16@2020_4/2020/09/16/05-04-12-368_449b24f2781221b5.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e8/Grow-a-Beard-Faster-Step-13-Version-3.jpg/aid2670008-v4-728px-Grow-a-Beard-Faster-Step-13-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx23/cdn79@2020_5/2020/09/16/05-04-07-499_600c229f4263e08e.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f3/Grow-a-Beard-Faster-Step-14-Version-2.jpg/aid2670008-v4-728px-Grow-a-Beard-Faster-Step-14-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn92@2020_2/2020/09/16/05-04-12-843_28a4332b3510a7ac.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/03/Grow-a-Beard-Faster-Step-15.jpg/aid2670008-v4-728px-Grow-a-Beard-Faster-Step-15.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn26@2020_6/2020/09/16/05-04-13-221_d876ac7e45b95cca.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/0e/Grow-a-Beard-Faster-Step-16.jpg/aid2670008-v4-728px-Grow-a-Beard-Faster-Step-16.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn21@2020_3/2020/09/16/05-04-07-333_c388360267012318.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1600232627626},{"createdTime":"2020-09-16 13:03:47","updatedTime":"2020-09-16 13:03:47","title":"How to Live on a Budget","link":"https://www.wikihow.com/Live-on-a-Budget","description":"<div class=\"mw-parser-output\">\n <p>Whether you're barely making ends meet or you're coasting along comfortably, sticking to a budget will help give you more control over your money. That's because you'll have a better idea of what you're spending, so you'll know if there are any areas where you need to cut back. Creating a budget isn't always fun, but financial freedom definitely is, so it's worth the time to take a good look at your spending habits and create a realistic plan for your money! </p> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Live-on-a-Budget&amp;action=edit&amp;section=1\" title=\"Edit section: Steps\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Steps\">Steps</span></h2> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Live-on-a-Budget&amp;action=edit&amp;section=2\" title=\"Edit section: Budgeting Help\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Budgeting-Help\">Budgeting Help</span></h3> \n <div id=\"sd_container\">\n  <div class=\"sd_thumb\">\n   <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Sample/List-of-Expenses\"><img class=\"whcdn\" width=\"340\" height=\"440\" data-src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/99/List-of-Expenses.png/340px-List-of-Expenses.png\" id=\"5f619bd37ca58\" /><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('5f619bd37ca58')</script>\n    <noscript>\n     <img class=\"whcdn\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/99/List-of-Expenses.png/340px-List-of-Expenses.png\" width=\"340\" height=\"440\" />\n    </noscript><span>Sample List of Expenses</span></a>\n  </div>\n  <div class=\"sd_thumb\">\n   <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Sample/Low-Income-Budget\"><img class=\"whcdn\" width=\"340\" height=\"440\" data-src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/15/Low-Income-Budget.png/340px-Low-Income-Budget.png\" id=\"5f619bd37dafa\" /><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('5f619bd37dafa')</script>\n    <noscript>\n     <img class=\"whcdn\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/15/Low-Income-Budget.png/340px-Low-Income-Budget.png\" width=\"340\" height=\"440\" />\n    </noscript><span>Sample Low Income Budget</span></a>\n  </div>\n  <div class=\"sd_thumb\">\n   <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Sample/High-Income-Budget\"><img class=\"whcdn\" width=\"340\" height=\"440\" data-src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/89/High-Income-Budget.png/340px-High-Income-Budget.png\" id=\"5f619bd37e9ca\" /><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('5f619bd37e9ca')</script>\n    <noscript>\n     <img class=\"whcdn\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/89/High-Income-Budget.png/340px-High-Income-Budget.png\" width=\"340\" height=\"440\" />\n    </noscript><span>Sample High Income Budget</span></a>\n  </div>\n </div> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Live-on-a-Budget&amp;action=edit&amp;section=3\" title=\"Edit section: Budgeting Your Money\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Budgeting-Your-Money\">Budgeting Your Money</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Create a starting budget by subtracting your expenses from your income. To get started making your budget, add up all of the money you get in a month. Then, calculate your average expenses for a month, and anything else you spend money on. Finally, subtract your expenses from your income to see if you're spending more than you make.<sup id=\"_ref-1\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 1\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Live-on-a-Budget#_note-1\">[1]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Live-on-a-Budget-Step-1-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Live on a Budget Step 1 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/18/Live-on-a-Budget-Step-1-Version-3.jpg/aid1610872-v4-728px-Live-on-a-Budget-Step-1-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Your income might include any money you earn from a job, contributions from your family or others, and any other payments or financial assistance you receive.</li> \n    <li>Your expenses will include bills like your rent or mortgage, car payment, and insurance, as well as things like groceries, clothing, books, and entertainment. Some of these expenses will be the same each month, like your rent, while you'll need to calculate the monthly average of others, like groceries.</li> \n    <li>Try this worksheet to help you determine your starting budget: <a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://www.consumer.gov/content/make-budget-worksheet\">https://www.consumer.gov/content/make-budget-worksheet</a></li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Set spending limits based on your starting budget. Once you see a basic breakdown of where your money is going, evaluate the way you're spending your money. If there are any areas where you're currently overspending, try gradually cutting them back to make a little more room in your budget.<sup id=\"_ref-2\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 2\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Live-on-a-Budget#_note-2\">[2]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Live-on-a-Budget-Step-2-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Live on a Budget Step 2 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/64/Live-on-a-Budget-Step-2-Version-3.jpg/aid1610872-v4-728px-Live-on-a-Budget-Step-2-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Try breaking your expenses into categories to see what you're spending. For instance, you might list things like your rent, phone bill, and utility bill in a category titled \"Bills.\" Expenses like groceries and dining out might go into a category titled \"Food,\" and things like clothing and school supplies for your children might go into \"Kids.\"</li> \n    <li>Unless you need to drastically cut down on your spending, it's usually best to start by setting small, easily attainable savings goals. For instance, if you spend a lot of money on streaming services, you might start by canceling the one you use the least, rather than eliminating them all right away.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Track your spending to ensure you stay within your spending limits. It's not enough to set limits for yourself; you also have to monitor what you're actually spending to make sure you don't go over those limits. The exact way you do this will depend on what works best for you—you might find it easier to write down each purchase as you make it, or you might prefer going over your bank and credit card statements at the end of the month to see how you did.<sup id=\"_ref-3\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 3\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Live-on-a-Budget#_note-3\">[3]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Live-on-a-Budget-Step-3-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Live on a Budget Step 3 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a4/Live-on-a-Budget-Step-3-Version-3.jpg/aid1610872-v4-728px-Live-on-a-Budget-Step-3-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>One benefit of writing down your purchases as you go is that it's easier to remember exactly what you bought. However, some people find this tedious.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Leave some room in your budget for extras. It's hard to stick to a budget if it makes you feel like you can't enjoy your favorite things in life. If you're able to, try to leave at least a little extra money every month for things you really enjoy, like having a night out with friends or buying new craft supplies.<sup id=\"_ref-4\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 4\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Live-on-a-Budget#_note-4\">[4]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Live-on-a-Budget-Step-4-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Live on a Budget Step 4 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/61/Live-on-a-Budget-Step-4-Version-3.jpg/aid1610872-v4-728px-Live-on-a-Budget-Step-4-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Being on a budget can actually help you free up extra money for the things you love, because you'll be less likely to impulsively spend on things you don't really want.</li> \n    <li>Remember to be realistic—if you can't figure out how to make room for something in your budget, you might have to let it go.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Put some money from each paycheck into savings. It can seem hard to save when you're on a budget, but having a little money put aside for emergencies or unforeseen expenses can be a life-saver when you need it. When you're planning out your budget, make it a priority to put even a little money into savings every time you get paid. Even if it doesn't seem like much, it will start to add up quickly!<sup id=\"_ref-5\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 5\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Live-on-a-Budget#_note-5\">[5]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Live-on-a-Budget-Step-5-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Live on a Budget Step 5 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b6/Live-on-a-Budget-Step-5-Version-3.jpg/aid1610872-v4-728px-Live-on-a-Budget-Step-5-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Start by setting a reasonable goal, like saving $10 or $20 a week for a few months. Once that begins to feel comfortable, challenge yourself to increase the amount, if you're able.</li> \n    <li>Eventually, you should try to have about 3-6 months' worth of expenses saved in case you find yourself unable to work.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Try the envelope method to help organize your cash. If you mostly use cash to pay for things, it can be hard sometimes to keep up with where it goes. One way to help keep your cash spending on track is to divide your money into different envelopes. Label each envelope with what the money's for, and only spend what you have set aside.<sup id=\"_ref-6\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 6\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Live-on-a-Budget#_note-6\">[6]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Live-on-a-Budget-Step-6-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Live on a Budget Step 6 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/08/Live-on-a-Budget-Step-6-Version-2.jpg/aid1610872-v4-728px-Live-on-a-Budget-Step-6-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>For instance, you might have envelopes labelled \"Groceries,\" \"Clothing,\" \"Medical Bills,\" and \"Dining Out.\" If you know you're going to be meeting friends for lunch, you'd grab the \"Dining Out\" envelope.</li> \n    <li>Don't borrow from other envelopes if you overspend, or else you could run short in another category at the end of the month.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Write down your bills in a calendar to help pay them on time. Get a calendar, planner, or app that will help you keep track of each bill you owe each month, as well as their due dates. That way, you won't accidentally forget to pay a bill, which can cost you extra money in late fees and other penalties.<sup id=\"_ref-7\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 7\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Live-on-a-Budget#_note-7\">[7]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Live-on-a-Budget-Step-7-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Live on a Budget Step 7 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/fb/Live-on-a-Budget-Step-7-Version-2.jpg/aid1610872-v4-728px-Live-on-a-Budget-Step-7-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Making late payments can have a sneaky impact on your long-term budget, as well. They can lower your credit score, meaning you'll get higher interest rates on things like a car loan or mortgage—and a higher interest rate means higher monthly payments.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Live-on-a-Budget&amp;action=edit&amp;section=4\" title=\"Edit section: Staying Disciplined\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Staying-Disciplined\">Staying Disciplined</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Learn to say no and avoid temptations. These days, there are endless opportunities to spend money. If you want to successfully stick to a budget, it will take self-discipline and willpower. It won't always be easy, but try to keep your goals in mind when you're tempted to buy something you don't really need. Also, get in the habit of occasionally turning down invitations from friends, especially if you tend to spend a lot of money while you're out.<sup id=\"_ref-8\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 8\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Live-on-a-Budget#_note-8\">[8]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Live-on-a-Budget-Step-8-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Live on a Budget Step 8 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/64/Live-on-a-Budget-Step-8-Version-2.jpg/aid1610872-v4-728px-Live-on-a-Budget-Step-8-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>It might be necessary to avoid places where you're often tempted to spend more than your budget, especially at first. If you tend to shop online, try unsubscribing from promotional emails so you won't feel like you're missing out.</li> \n    <li>When you do go out, bring cash, and only what you can afford to spend.</li> \n    <li>Try repeating a mantra when you're tempted to spend. For instance, if you're saving for a trip, your mantra might be, \"Beach vacation!\"</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Transfer money to your savings automatically. Each week, have a certain amount transferred from your paycheck directly into a separate savings account. It's a lot easier to save money if you don't actually see it first.<sup id=\"_ref-9\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 9\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Live-on-a-Budget#_note-9\">[9]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Live-on-a-Budget-Step-9-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Live on a Budget Step 9 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/48/Live-on-a-Budget-Step-9-Version-2.jpg/aid1610872-v4-728px-Live-on-a-Budget-Step-9-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>This goes for things like retirement contributions and a healthcare savings account (HSA) if you have them, as well.</li> \n    <li>If you get paid in cash, get in the habit of taking out your savings as soon as you get paid—preferably before you spend anything else.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Set financial challenges for yourself. If you want to manage your money a little better, try creating a personal challenge, like bringing your lunch to work for 30 days or not buying any new clothes for 3 months. Sometimes you just need an extra push to change your habits.<sup id=\"_ref-10\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 10\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Live-on-a-Budget#_note-10\">[10]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Live-on-a-Budget-Step-10-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Live on a Budget Step 10 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/be/Live-on-a-Budget-Step-10-Version-2.jpg/aid1610872-v4-728px-Live-on-a-Budget-Step-10-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Try telling a friend about your challenge to help hold yourself accountable!</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Avoid using credit cards unless you can pay them off. When you buy something on a credit card, you generally aren't charged interest if you pay off the whole balance each month. However, if you only pay the minimum amount due, you'll continue being charged interest every month until the balance is gone.<sup id=\"_ref-11\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 11\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Live-on-a-Budget#_note-11\">[11]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Live-on-a-Budget-Step-11-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Live on a Budget Step 11 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/33/Live-on-a-Budget-Step-11-Version-2.jpg/aid1610872-v4-728px-Live-on-a-Budget-Step-11-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Credit cards make it easy to overspend, since they seem like free money. If you have trouble controlling your spending, it's probably best to avoid them altogether.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Keep trying, even if you mess up. While it's important to be financially responsible, it's also important not to beat yourself up if you spend a little too much money here and there. Even if you've made big money mistakes in the past, try to keep your attention focused on the future, and keep putting one foot in front of the other until you hit your goals.<sup id=\"_ref-12\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 12\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Live-on-a-Budget#_note-12\">[12]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Live-on-a-Budget-Step-12-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Live on a Budget Step 12 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/8b/Live-on-a-Budget-Step-12-Version-2.jpg/aid1610872-v4-728px-Live-on-a-Budget-Step-12-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Remember, it takes time to learn new habits, so don't get too discouraged if you have trouble hitting your budgeting goals. Sometimes, this can even be a sign that you need to change your budget, rather than your spending, so keep evaluating and adjusting your finances every month.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Live-on-a-Budget&amp;action=edit&amp;section=5\" title=\"Edit section: Finding Ways to Save\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Finding-Ways-to-Save\">Finding Ways to Save</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Comparison shop before you make a purchase. The internet makes it incredibly easy to see prices for the same item across different stores, so you can always get the best deal. You can comparison shop for everything from groceries and school supplies to your cell phone plan or car loan, so take advantage of the resources you have available to ensure you don't overspend.<sup id=\"_ref-13\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 13\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Live-on-a-Budget#_note-13\">[13]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Live-on-a-Budget-Step-13-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Live on a Budget Step 13 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/9a/Live-on-a-Budget-Step-13-Version-2.jpg/aid1610872-v4-728px-Live-on-a-Budget-Step-13-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Try searching for items in sites like Google Shopping, Shopzilla, and Bizrate to compare prices from different retailers.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Cook at home for most of your meals. Even if you don't think you eat out very often, you may be spending a lot more money than you realize on things like fast food and snacks from the convenience store. To help avoid that, plan out your meals ahead of time, and pick up groceries about once a week with everything you'll need for each meal.<sup id=\"_ref-14\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 14\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Live-on-a-Budget#_note-14\">[14]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Live-on-a-Budget-Step-14-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Live on a Budget Step 14 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/5c/Live-on-a-Budget-Step-14-Version-2.jpg/aid1610872-v4-728px-Live-on-a-Budget-Step-14-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Make your grocery shopping more efficient by couponing and planning to use the same ingredients in multiple meals.</li> \n    <li>If you find a good deal on meat or produce, buy extra and freeze some to use later.</li> \n    <li>Dress up cheap ingredients to make them more exciting! For instance, you can make a tasty meal out of ramen noodles by adding a fried egg and thinly-sliced green onions.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Shop secondhand and clearance sales whenever possible. You can often save a lot of money if you're willing to buy something secondhand rather than new. Try checking thrift stores and consignment shops in your area to see if they have anything that you've been meaning to buy. You can also find good deals by shopping for off-season clothes in the clearance section at your favorite store.<sup id=\"_ref-15\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 15\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Live-on-a-Budget#_note-15\">[15]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Live-on-a-Budget-Step-15-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Live on a Budget Step 15 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/bc/Live-on-a-Budget-Step-15-Version-2.jpg/aid1610872-v4-728px-Live-on-a-Budget-Step-15-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Look for \"free shipping with no minimum\" deals when you're shopping online, or use membership perks that come with free shipping.</li> \n    <li>Remember to check resale and auction sites online! However, use caution before you meet anyone in person to buy something from them—it's best to bring someone along with you, and leave if you get a bad feeling.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Cancel your cable if you use a lot of streaming sites. If you spend most of your time watching shows on Netflix, Prime Video, or Hulu, you may find that you'd be perfectly fine without your cable provider. This is called \"cutting the cord,\" and it's an increasingly popular way to save a little extra money on your monthly budget.<sup id=\"_ref-16\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 16\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Live-on-a-Budget#_note-16\">[16]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Live-on-a-Budget-Step-16-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Live on a Budget Step 16 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/8f/Live-on-a-Budget-Step-16-Version-2.jpg/aid1610872-v4-728px-Live-on-a-Budget-Step-16-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>On the other hand, you might find that it's more cost-effective to bundle services like your internet, cable, and cell phone. In that case, you might cancel any streaming services you don't use often.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Live-on-a-Budget&amp;action=edit&amp;section=6\" title=\"Edit section: References\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"References\">References</span></h2> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span Summary\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Quick-Summary\">Quick Summary</span></h2>\n <div class=\"mw-references-wrap <li id=\"_note-12\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Live-on-a-Budget#_ref-12\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" id=\"_note-16\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Live-on-a-Budget#_ref-16\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" </li> \n  </ol>\n </div> \n</div>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Tue, 08 Sep 2020 08:00:00 +0000","feedId":44,"bgimg":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/99/List-of-Expenses.png/340px-List-of-Expenses.png","linkMd5":"74683c3b8ce5664c4feb6b356a15aa2e","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn52@2020_6/2020/09/16/05-03-47-983_62339c07f200049c.webp","destWidth":340,"destHeight":440,"sourceBytes":27628,"destBytes":6932,"author":"","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/99/List-of-Expenses.png/340px-List-of-Expenses.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn52@2020_6/2020/09/16/05-03-47-983_62339c07f200049c.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/15/Low-Income-Budget.png/340px-Low-Income-Budget.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn92@2020_2/2020/09/16/05-04-09-674_5471a7e372511e88.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/89/High-Income-Budget.png/340px-High-Income-Budget.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn83@2020_1/2020/09/16/05-04-07-689_c065f0188c757bda.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/18/Live-on-a-Budget-Step-1-Version-3.jpg/aid1610872-v4-728px-Live-on-a-Budget-Step-1-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn24@2020_3/2020/09/16/05-04-06-293_b39b97ca79363f73.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/64/Live-on-a-Budget-Step-2-Version-3.jpg/aid1610872-v4-728px-Live-on-a-Budget-Step-2-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn14@2020_6/2020/09/16/05-04-06-254_37cdcecc3b6a445a.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a4/Live-on-a-Budget-Step-3-Version-3.jpg/aid1610872-v4-728px-Live-on-a-Budget-Step-3-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn100@2020_1/2020/09/16/05-04-10-609_0a90532fbcc6ebf6.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/61/Live-on-a-Budget-Step-4-Version-3.jpg/aid1610872-v4-728px-Live-on-a-Budget-Step-4-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn96@2020_5/2020/09/16/05-04-11-255_63eff913a3133af9.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b6/Live-on-a-Budget-Step-5-Version-3.jpg/aid1610872-v4-728px-Live-on-a-Budget-Step-5-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn68@2020_5/2020/09/16/05-04-12-836_560e4e62630a32eb.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/08/Live-on-a-Budget-Step-6-Version-2.jpg/aid1610872-v4-728px-Live-on-a-Budget-Step-6-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn56@2020_3/2020/09/16/05-04-13-375_257f77b5e50d6fda.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/fb/Live-on-a-Budget-Step-7-Version-2.jpg/aid1610872-v4-728px-Live-on-a-Budget-Step-7-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn60@2020_4/2020/09/16/05-04-11-109_6fcfe7f851930cc6.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/64/Live-on-a-Budget-Step-8-Version-2.jpg/aid1610872-v4-728px-Live-on-a-Budget-Step-8-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn50@2020_6/2020/09/16/05-04-06-245_c138f559752804f6.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/48/Live-on-a-Budget-Step-9-Version-2.jpg/aid1610872-v4-728px-Live-on-a-Budget-Step-9-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn27@2020_3/2020/09/16/05-04-12-311_ea16e5a577e78cfe.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/be/Live-on-a-Budget-Step-10-Version-2.jpg/aid1610872-v4-728px-Live-on-a-Budget-Step-10-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn8@2020_1/2020/09/16/05-04-08-676_87d09cebccbf7d46.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/33/Live-on-a-Budget-Step-11-Version-2.jpg/aid1610872-v4-728px-Live-on-a-Budget-Step-11-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn63@2020_4/2020/09/16/05-04-11-043_2392c39f4216fe4f.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/8b/Live-on-a-Budget-Step-12-Version-2.jpg/aid1610872-v4-728px-Live-on-a-Budget-Step-12-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn31@2020_5/2020/09/16/05-04-12-317_6763e325a3da19a9.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/9a/Live-on-a-Budget-Step-13-Version-2.jpg/aid1610872-v4-728px-Live-on-a-Budget-Step-13-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn37@2020_2/2020/09/16/05-04-06-612_9abdbb7d3f5a14cd.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/5c/Live-on-a-Budget-Step-14-Version-2.jpg/aid1610872-v4-728px-Live-on-a-Budget-Step-14-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn12@2020_1/2020/09/16/05-04-08-138_de05156e4d85b5ee.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/bc/Live-on-a-Budget-Step-15-Version-2.jpg/aid1610872-v4-728px-Live-on-a-Budget-Step-15-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn9@2020_2/2020/09/16/05-04-06-159_61d0ec137ac10a4e.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/8f/Live-on-a-Budget-Step-16-Version-2.jpg/aid1610872-v4-728px-Live-on-a-Budget-Step-16-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn75@2020_6/2020/09/16/05-04-12-819_dcfa02b4745627aa.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1600232627635},{"createdTime":"2020-09-16 13:03:47","updatedTime":"2020-09-16 13:03:47","title":"How to Grill Zucchini","link":"https://www.wikihow.com/Grill-Zucchini","description":"<div class=\"mw-parser-output\">\n <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n  <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Grill-Zucchini.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Grill Zucchini.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/af/Grill-Zucchini.jpg/aid4346099-v4-728px-Grill-Zucchini.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"273\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n </div> \n <p>Zucchini is perfect for dinner parties and barbecues in the summer months. Served as the main course or as a tantalizing side dish, zucchini is easy to cook on any grill, indoors or out. Tender, delicious, and crunchy, zucchini is a versatile vegetable, offering creative chefs plenty of opportunities to experiment. </p> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Grill-Zucchini&amp;action=edit&amp;section=1\" title=\"Edit section: Steps\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Steps\">Steps</span></h2> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Grill-Zucchini&amp;action=edit&amp;section=2\" title=\"Edit section: Basic Grilled Zucchini\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Basic-Grilled-Zucchini\">Basic Grilled Zucchini</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Heat up the grill. Grilled zucchini is delicious when well-seared. This requires using a grill that is at least medium-hot. Hotter grills would brand a set of appealing blackened grill marks, but if you're worried about burning your vegetables, you may want to opt for medium heat. You can always simply cook your zucchini for longer if they aren't done to your liking.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Grill-Zucchini-Step-1-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Grill Zucchini Step 1 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/0f/Grill-Zucchini-Step-1-Version-2.jpg/aid4346099-v4-728px-Grill-Zucchini-Step-1-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"410\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Heating up a grill is easy. Turn a gas grill on, start the flow of gas and hit the lighter, close the lid, and let the grill heat. If you are using <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Light-a-Charcoal-Grill\" title=\"Light a Charcoal Grill\">a charcoal grill</a>, light the charcoal. Wait until the charcoal is ashy and glowing orange.</li> \n    <li>While waiting for the grill to heat up, do the prep work for your meal. For example, you may want to set the table, prepare the other dishes, or start chopping your zucchini.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Slice the zucchini. The key to grilling zucchini is to use thin slices, not thick pieces. Thick pieces of zucchinis may end up charred on the outside but uncooked inside. You can cut the zucchini into rounds, cubes, wedges, or even strips!<br /><br /> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Chop zucchini into circular slices about thick. These are easy to cut and easy to eat. This is a good choice when the zucchini is to be eaten as its own dish.</li> \n    <li>Chop zucchini into cubes approximately on each side. These bite-sized chunks work well for kabobs.</li> \n    <li>Chop your zucchini into wedges. Long, thin wedges cook well on the grill. Cut the zucchini into eighths lengthwise.</li> \n    <li>Slice your zucchini into long, thin strips. These are a little challenging — you need to cut the zucchini lengthwise into thin, paper-like strips just thick or so. This requires a steady hand, but it's great for when you want to roll up ingredients in the zucchini pieces to make mini \"wraps.\"</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Drizzle the zucchini with oil. When your zucchini pieces are all chopped up, transfer them to a mixing bowl. Drizzle on about of cooking oil per zucchini. Mix the contents of the bowl until the zucchini pieces are all evenly coated. The oil will lend the zucchini pieces a little extra flavor, help them cook, and keep them from sticking to the hot grill.<br /><br /> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Olive oil is a good choice for its flavor, but it has a low smoke point, which means it will start smoking at hot temperatures. If you don't want to deal with the extra smoke, you might want to try an oil with a higher smoke point, like vegetable oil, canola oil, or peanut oil.<sup id=\"_ref-1\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 1\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Grill-Zucchini#_note-1\">[1]</a></sup></li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Grill the zucchini for 2 minutes. Use a set of tongs to pick up the zucchini pieces and lay them on the grill one at a time. You should hear a sizzling sound as soon as the zucchini touches the hot surface. Grill the zucchini for about 2 minutes uninterrupted.<br /><br /> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If you chopped your zucchini into thin pieces, be sure to lay them at a 90-degree angle to the bars of the grill so they don't fall through.</li> \n    <li>If you're worried about your zucchini sticking to the grill, use a grill brush or a paper towel to carefully paint the bars of the grill with oil before laying the zucchini pieces down.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Flip the zucchini and cook it for another 2 minutes. After a few minutes of cooking, the sides of the zucchini pieces touching the grill should be well-browned and tender. Flip the zucchini pieces over to cook the other side and let sit for a minute or two. Repeat as needed until the zucchinis are tender and browned all over.<br /><br />\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Grill-Zucchini-Step-5-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Grill Zucchini Step 5 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c1/Grill-Zucchini-Step-5-Version-2.jpg/aid4346099-v4-728px-Grill-Zucchini-Step-5-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"410\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>For zucchinis that are evenly-cooked to perfection, flip your zucchini pieces in the same order as you added them to the grill. This ensures that all the sides will cook for the same amount of time.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Season and serve the zucchini. When your zucchini pieces are cooked on all sides, transfer them from the grill to a clean serving platter. Let them sit for a few minutes until they are cool enough to eat, then sprinkle them with the seasonings of your choice and serve them immediately. Congratulations — you've just made grilled zucchini!<br /><br />\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Grill-Zucchini-Step-6-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Grill Zucchini Step 6 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/cc/Grill-Zucchini-Step-6-Version-2.jpg/aid4346099-v4-728px-Grill-Zucchini-Step-6-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"410\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>There's no \"right\" seasoning to put on your zucchini, but if you're looking for something everyone will like, try lightly seasoning with salt and black pepper. Other good choices include garlic salt and cajun seasoning!</li> \n    <li>Try this recipe as a low-carb, easy side dish with your next meal.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Grill-Zucchini&amp;action=edit&amp;section=3\" title=\"Edit section: Variations\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Variations\">Variations</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Marinate the zucchini in vinaigrette to add flavor. When you're tired of the ordinary zucchini taste, try spicing things up by soaking your zucchini in a flavorful marinade before cooking. Combine a little cooking oil with your favorite acidic ingredients (like vinegar or citrus juice), throw in the seasonings of your choice, and let the vegetables soak before cooking.<sup id=\"_ref-2\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 2\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Grill-Zucchini#_note-2\">[2]</a></sup><br /><br /> \n   <ul>\n    <li>For example, mix of balsamic vinegar and of olive oil. Add a few pinches of garlic powder and a spoonful of dried rosemary, basil, and oregano — whichever you have. Pour into an airtight container, add your zucchini pieces, and let them soak for at least a few hours before cooking.</li> \n    <li>If you are in a hurry and don't have time to marinate your vegetables, don't worry. Simply toss them in a bowl with about of Italian vinaigrette salad dressing per zucchini and cook them immediately.<sup id=\"_ref-3\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 3\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Grill-Zucchini#_note-3\">[3]</a></sup></li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Make a lemon-garlic sauce for a savory zucchini dish. Zucchini's mild taste goes great with tangy citrus flavors, the savory twang of garlic, and the richness of butter. This lemon-garlic sauce makes a great addition to plain grilled zucchini — use it in place of cooking oil to paint the vegetables before grilling.<sup id=\"_ref-4\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 4\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Grill-Zucchini#_note-4\">[4]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Grill-Zucchini-Step-8-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Grill Zucchini Step 8 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/88/Grill-Zucchini-Step-8-Version-2.jpg/aid4346099-v4-728px-Grill-Zucchini-Step-8-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"410\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Melt 1/2 stick of butter with of lemon juice. Grate about 1 tablespoon of zest from the lemon peel into the mixture. Stir in 1 tsp (3.28 g) of garlic powder and 1 tsp (1 g) of dried oregano. If you have some, add a pinch of curry powder as well. Paint the zucchini pieces with the sauce and grill as normal.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Sprinkle the zucchini with citrus seasoning salt for a tangy option. Looking to add a little extra flavor to some plain old grilled zucchini pieces? Try making a citrus-tinged seasoning salt by mixing zest from your favorite citrus fruit with ordinary salt, then sprinkling it on just before serving. You can use lemons, limes, oranges, or whatever else you want.<sup id=\"_ref-5\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 5\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Grill-Zucchini#_note-5\">[5]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Grill-Zucchini-Step-9-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Grill Zucchini Step 9 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b6/Grill-Zucchini-Step-9-Version-2.jpg/aid4346099-v4-728px-Grill-Zucchini-Step-9-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"410\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Cook the zucchini pieces as normal, then set them aside. As the zucchini cools, grab 3 lemons and use a fine grater or a microplane to grate the zest from the peels into a small pile on a cutting board. Add about 1 tbsp (17 g) of salt to the pile of zest, then use a knife to chop the salt and zest, combining them. Immediately use this to season the zucchini and serve. If you wait too long, the salt will dissolve.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Serve the zucchini with pesto sauce if you like to dip your veggies. Zucchini is great on its own, but if you're looking for a dish that's a little more satisfying, try serving it with a hearty pesto sauce. You can dip the vegetable pieces in the sauce, like chips and dip, or slice them extra-thin and make mini-wraps with the sauce — it's up to you.<sup id=\"_ref-6\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 6\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Grill-Zucchini#_note-6\">[6]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Grill-Zucchini-Step-10-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Grill Zucchini Step 10 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/27/Grill-Zucchini-Step-10-Version-2.jpg/aid4346099-v4-728px-Grill-Zucchini-Step-10-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"410\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Cook the zucchini pieces as normal. Add 1 cup (20 g) of basil leaves, 1 clove of garlic, of olive oil, and 1/4 cup (~33 g) of toasted pine nuts or walnuts to a blender. Pulse until well-combined. Gradually pour in 3/4 cup (~75 g) of grated Parmesan cheese, pulsing as you go to form a thick, rich pesto sauce. Serve the zucchini with pesto on the side or as the filling in mini-wraps.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Whip up zucchini <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Grill-Kabobs\" title=\"Grill Kabobs\">kabobs</a> for a fun twist. Skewering zucchini pieces on a kabob by themselves or with other ingredients gives your guests a delicious, fun-to-eat meal. Zucchini pairs well with most common grilling ingredients, so depending on what you have available, you can make the exact kabob flavor combinations you desire. Good ingredients to add to a kabob with zucchini pieces include:<br /><br /> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Vegetables: Summer squash, bell peppers, onion chunks, mushrooms</li> \n    <li>Meat: Chicken, lamb, pork, beef</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Melt Parmesan cheese over zucchini for a rich dish. Savory, nutty Parmesan cheese goes well with the moderate flavor of zucchini. Melting the cheese over zucchini pieces on the grill gives a dish that's deliciously crisp and blackened on one side and richly cheesy on the other. See below for instructions.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Grill-Zucchini-Step-12-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Grill Zucchini Step 12 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/eb/Grill-Zucchini-Step-12-Version-2.jpg/aid4346099-v4-728px-Grill-Zucchini-Step-12-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"410\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>To make Parmesan zucchini, cut the zucchini into wide, thin pieces, then oil them and lay them on the grill as normal. Carefully sprinkle grated Parmesan cheese on top of each piece, then close the lid and allow the pieces to cook for 2-3 minutes. When the zucchini is tender and the cheese is melted, remove the pieces from the grill — you don't have to flip them.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Grill zucchini with other vegetables in a grill basket for a healthy side dish. Looking to cook a lot of vegetables on the grill at once? One easy way to do this is to use a grill basket, which is basically a small metal cage with handles that's sold as a grill accessory. Filling a grill basket with mixed vegetables and cooking over a hot grill gives the vegetables deliciously crisp, blackened exteriors while allowing their flavors to blend together. Best of all, this keeps the rest of your grill free for meat or other dishes.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Grill-Zucchini-Step-13-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Grill Zucchini Step 13 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/33/Grill-Zucchini-Step-13-Version-2.jpg/aid4346099-v4-728px-Grill-Zucchini-Step-13-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"410\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>To prep vegetables for cooking in a grill basket, chop them into similar-sized pieces and toss them in olive oil. Add your favorite seasonings (rosemary and garlic powder are good choices) and stir to combine. Put the veggies in the basket and set the basket on the hot surface of the grill.</li> \n    <li>If you don't have a grill basket, you can get a similar effect by folding your vegetables into a pocket made from aluminum foil.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Grill-Zucchini&amp;action=edit&amp;section=4\" title=\"Edit section: Picking Out a Good Zucchini\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Picking-Out-a-Good-Zucchini\">Picking Out a Good Zucchini</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Look for a small-to-medium-sized zucchini. Bigger is not better when it comes to finding the perfect zucchini to grill. Larger zucchini tend to have their flavor \"spread out\" through the vegetable. That is, they're usually somewhat watery and flavorless compared to smaller zucchinis, so choose the latter for grilling.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Grill-Zucchini-Step-14-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Grill Zucchini Step 14 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/3b/Grill-Zucchini-Step-14-Version-2.jpg/aid4346099-v4-728px-Grill-Zucchini-Step-14-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"410\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>A good rule of thumb is not to pick a zucchini that's much bigger than a hand-held flashlight. A zucchini's taste starts to suffer after they reach about in length.<sup id=\"_ref-7\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 7\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Grill-Zucchini#_note-7\">[7]</a></sup></li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Look for a vibrant color. Did you know that not all zucchinis are green? In fact, perfectly-ripe zucchinis can be green, yellow, and even white.<sup id=\"_ref-8\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 8\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Grill-Zucchini#_note-8\">[8]</a></sup> No matter what color of zucchini you get, check the vegetable to make sure its color appears rich, bright, and vibrant.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Grill-Zucchini-Step-15-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Grill Zucchini Step 15 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/75/Grill-Zucchini-Step-15-Version-2.jpg/aid4346099-v4-728px-Grill-Zucchini-Step-15-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"410\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Dull or dead-looking zucchinis, on the other hand, may be a sign that the vegetables are past their prime.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Feel for a firm, smooth texture. A ripe zucchini that's ready for grilling should be firm and crisp. However, it shouldn't be outright hard — the flesh should give very slightly when squeezed. Run your hand down the length of the zucchini to check for nicks, cuts, and other deformations. If you find any, pick a different zucchini.<sup id=\"_ref-9\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 9\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Grill-Zucchini#_note-9\">[9]</a></sup><br /><br /> \n   <ul>\n    <li>The best zucchinis have a very soft, subtle \"hair\" on them. You should be able to feel this light, bristly texture with the back of your hand.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Store zucchini in the fridge for about a week. Fresh, high-quality zucchini lasts about a week in the fridge. If you can, place the zucchini in a paper bag, rather than a plastic one. Airtight plastic materials can trap in moisture, making the zucchini get slimy and spoil faster.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Grill-Zucchini-Step-17-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Grill Zucchini Step 17 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/73/Grill-Zucchini-Step-17-Version-2.jpg/aid4346099-v4-728px-Grill-Zucchini-Step-17-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"410\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Tightly-wrapped zucchinis also store for months in the freezer. In this case, you <i>will</i> want to wrap the zucchini tightly in plastic wrap or place it in a tight ziplock bag. <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Blanch-Vegetables\" title=\"Blanch Vegetables\">Blanching</a> the zucchini before freezing it can prevent it from discoloring and losing its texture while frozen.<sup id=\"_ref-10\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 10\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Grill-Zucchini#_note-10\">[10]</a></sup></li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Grill-Zucchini&amp;action=edit&amp;section=5\" title=\"Edit section: Tips\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Tips\">Tips</span></h2> \n <ul>\n  <li>If you're also cooking meat on the grill, don't let your zucchini touch uncooked meat — if it does, let it cook for a little longer to kill any bacteria.</li> \n  <li>Zucchini pairs especially well with yellow summer squash. In fact, these vegetables are actually very closely related (zucchinis are a type of squash), which explains their similar tastes.</li>\n </ul> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Grill-Zucchini&amp;action=edit&amp;section=6\" title=\"Edit section: Related wikiHows\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Related-wikiHows\">Related wikiHows</span></h2> \n <ul>\n  <li><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Cook-Zucchini\" title=\"Cook Zucchini\">Cook Zucchini</a></li>\n </ul> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Grill-Zucchini&amp;action=edit&amp;section=7\" title=\"Edit section: References\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"References\">References</span></h2> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Grill-Zucchini&amp;action=edit&amp;section=8\" title=\"Edit section: Quick Summary\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Quick-Summary\">Quick Summary</span></h2>\n <div class=\"mw-references-wrap\">\n  <ol class=\"references\"> \n   <li id=\"_note-1\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Grill-Zucchini#_ref-1\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow
